text:
F: big, tan, long lasting.
C: coppery, clear.
A: malty, sharp fruity, caramel, strawberry, cherries, light toffee.
T: caramel malty, mellow fruity, cherries, nutty, raisins, bit of cocoa, light oily texture, decent bitterness on the palate, full body, low to medium carbonation, enjoyed, 0,5l bottle from Sainsburys supermarket, Camden, London.

Pours copper with a large off-white head, and some lacing. Aroma of ripe fruit, strong caramel, cake and spices. Taste gets the same, with all this sweetness of cake and caramel, ripe fruits not overly sweet and well balanced. Smooth, medium body, not over carbonated, medium dry finish. This is a classic and Im happy that even after years and thousands of different beers I still enjoy it!

Summan av alla laster är konstanta. Och tar man med den här 1845:an i beräkningarna är det säkrast att resten av livet präglas av celibat och långsamma bilar. Över huvud taget jävligt mustig på alla håll och kanter med kola-, choklad- och russinarom. Kraftigt rostad smak med en aning lakrits och frukt. Sällan har det känts så motiverat att avstå kubanska cigarrer och magdans.
Brun öl med ett beige skum. Doft av malt, mörkt socker, torkad frukt och alkoholsötma. I smaken tillkommer nötighet och humlebeska.

Aroma - intense, sweet and floral, with lot of flowers, caramel and quince jam in the first plan, then honey and caramelized fruits with some delicate alcohol. Taste - very complex, with medium intensity and very well balanced, with lot of caramelized fruit jam, honey quince jam, then a soft bitterness and a bit of alcohol in the final/aftertaste. Very delicious and very pleasant.
A lovely premium ale. Nice burnt coffee notes on the palate, a beautiful aroma. Will definitely seek out more of Fullers in the future.

2016 catch up - Bottle at home - A bitter "with the volume turned up." Hops, malt and alcohol all present in abundance, plus a slight, but welcome sweetness. Lovely mouth feel and a good lingering flavour. Very good, but quite rich.

From old tasting notes. Copper red color topped by a huge thick rocky beige head.maromatic malt nose reminiscent of toffee and brown sugar. Bittersweet caramel malt flavor hints at burnt sugar. There Ias a bitter hop finish that balances this ale nicely. A long chewy malty aftertaste completes this complex flavorful ale.

Sample @"Malt, mat&destillat" Sthlm. Amber, white head. Aroma is very intense with malts, raisins, fruit. Taste is nutty and not overly sweet, but adds to the complexity of the overall impression of this lovely beer. With its well balanced English hops, this is an outstanding beer in my book.

UPDATED: APR 4, 2017 (500 ml bottle) Dark amber-brown beer, bottle conditioned, with a small, off-white head. Full-bodied and smooth mouthfeel. Aroma of nuts, dried fruit, honey on toast, candied peel, toffee, soy sauce, and a warming hint of alcohol. The hops are muted by massive malty flavours, but some clove esters shine through. Finishes mildly bitter, with a slight pine-sap afternote.

Very pleasant English Strong Ale, to be sipped slowly.
Amber with a beige head. Dark dried fruit aroma. Malt sweetness is balanced by hop bitterness and drying alcohol. Fruity and nutty. Gets better as it warms up.

Strong ale da bel colore bruno- ramato. Aromi dominati dal malto con una nota di frutta rossa. In bocca i sapori principali sono di caramello e pane tostato. Luppolatura presente solo nel finale donando un retrogusto piacevolmente amarognolo.

0.5 L bottle. Pours clear, dark bronze color, with a small, fleeting, beige head. Toasted caramel aromas, with some smoke, syrup, plums, leather, and earth. Sweet and malty, with a sharp, sticky bitterness. Heavy body, smooth, and a little sticky. This is a malty, sticky, and aggressively hopped beer. Like a smoother and more friendly version of Arrogant Bastard.
Spicy, treacley. Very sweet. A bit appley. Its not too bad. Doable but no stunner. I prefer esb

500ml bbNov2017, merci BeardedAvenger for the trade. - Tightens the gap between fruitcake-malty UK strong ale and apricot-jenever Belgian tripel. Quite fumy with sweet abv esters for 6,3%, reminds me of a boozy baby Piraat with a tad more class. Sticky apricot jam and overcooked fruitcake flavoured. Becomes quite bitter with atea leaf and walnut peel astringency midway and all the way past the final sip.
From bottle in tulip. Pours hazy amber with aroma of fruitbread and (yes) nutmeg. Rich malt-driven taste with almost woody spice undertones. Quite a tasty drop.

Dark amber/Copper slightly hazy with one finger of off white head
Nose has loads of malt, mixed spice and herbs. 
Mouthfeel is lush and smooth with moderate carbonation. 
Upfront is malty with hints of caramel and fruit cake mixed spice, quickly giving way to those lingering hops with herbs, nettles and hint of citrus pith. It's refreshing and satisfying. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle at home. Clear copper colour. On the bitter side. Spice on the nose. Caramel malts. Medium body. Very drinkable.

Bottle. Dark amber color with off-white head. Aroma has wood, dark fruits, grass and malt. Taste is malty with long bitter and quite dry aftertaste. Flavors of dark fruits, malt, caramel, wood. Nice balance.
Cask at fullers pub in London. rich full creamy body and full flavour. flowers and bread.

Bottle At Heathrow. Dark amber, slight haze, small bubbly head. Woody, malty aroma, fruitcake. Taste gets a bit tangy and spicy, caramel, brown bread. A bit of warmth from the ABV, quite evident here after a week of gentle bitters.

Red. Fruity esters and caramel malt unfold in this pretty and harmonious strong ale. The full and sweet (but balanced) taste ends with a solidly bitter and slightly hoppy finish. Full body. Overall, a great english strong ale. Tasty and very drinkable.

Some chalk, little iron, little sweetness, very British. Love it that they call this 6.3 percent beer a strong ale.

Gift from uckelman

22. 11. 2016, Ljubljana. Bottled (of course). Very large and resiliant amber head. Silky mouthful with sharp, distinguishable aromas. Many flavours combined.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Flaska från Systembolaget Hansa. Så här ska en öl se ut. Ett fantastiskt gräddigt smutsvitt skum som ligger likt en gräddbulle ovanpå drycken, som är mörkt bärnstensfärgad. Väldigt snyggt. Dofter av rågbröd, nöt, malt och toffee. Smakinslag av nöt, karamell, citrus och druvor. Lätt syrlighet i avslutningen.

Bottle. Amber copper coloured. Beautiful head. Aroma is nutty, malty and full of english hops. Maybe some vanilla. Taste: biscuit, fruity (orange?), honey, toffee, bready, caramell and slightly spicy. Nice long hoppy bitter finish. Low carbonation. Feels crisp and creamy at the same time. Complex enough for sipping but is also suited for a night of proper drinking. A very fine and satisfying ale.

500 ml bottle. Pours clear amber with an off-white head. Malty aroma of vanilla and coffe, smoked, alcohol distinguishable. Taste starts sweet, vanilla, hint of toffee, finish is coffee, bitter. Average carbonation, long finish, quite heavy to drink, pleasant. Good beer.

- braune Farbe mit einem schönen Rotschimmer und leichter Schaumbildung
- Aromen nach Rosinen, Nuss, Honig, Toffee, Orangenschalen, Brot, Aprikose
 und etwas Holz
- die Carbonisierung ist mir eine Idee zu moussierend
- der Antrunk überrascht angenehm durch die unerwartet bitteren Obertöne
- Nuss, Bitterorange und eine malzige Honigsüße begleiten im Mittelteil diese
 Hopfenbitternis in gelungener Art und Weise
- im Abgang noch eine dezent eingesetze Rauchnote und die Perfektion ist
 vollbracht
Fazit: Ein komplexes und perfektes Ale

0.5 l bottle. Deep copper color with long lasting, thin off-white head. Malt, bread, toffee, nuts and fruity notes in aroma. In taste it has pretty much the same notes, suplemented with some raisin. Quite long sweetish finish, combined with some bitter overtones, very soft carbonation and medium body. Nice brew.
Delicate aroma honey nuts pours amber small off white head and lacing. Taste dry wood treacle warming alcohol
amber to mahogany colour, moderate sized dense off-white head; aroma of biscuit, caramel, plum jam, some raisins and orange zest notes; taste is the same with toasted notes; good English-style ale

Deep bronze color. Smell of strong malt, toffee and dried fruits. Taste is similar with the smell strong malt with toffee and dried fruit. Some citrus maybe? A little citrus bitter, which is nice. Flat carbonation and medium bodied. Quite lovely 3.6 :)

Cor cobre com espuma bege clara de boa formação e persistência. Aroma de caramelo e marmelada. Sabor de caramelo, malte, passas ao final. Médio amargor persistente no retrogosto. Muito boa. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from BevMo! in Redwood City, CA. Aroma is honey, fruit, bread, pecans. Taste is malty, bready, fruity...extremely smooth. Holds strong and keeps you sipping. Very smooth and complex. By far the best English beer Ive had.

Una English Strong Ale de color ámbar y abundante espuma. Presenta un aroma a Malta con un toque frutal. Su sabor presenta un comienzo dulce de suave caramelo y frutos secos que termina con un amargor persistente.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Cloudy deep amber pour with a thick creamy light tan head. Aroma is toffee, caramel, hint of nuts and some subtle dried fruit. Taste is much the same, slightly sweet toffee and caramel, a little nutty and slightly earthy, creamy texture with low carbonation, a nice balanced finish. Really nice for the style.
Bottle. Hazy amber color with offwhite head. Aroma - Dried fruit, bread, caramel. Taste - Medium bitterness, bread, caramel, toffee.
Отличны& очень красивы& эль, хороший аромат с нотками меда и луговых цветов и вкус и продолж& послевк& с горчинк& 500ml in bottle ABV: 6.3%

0.5l bottle. Deep orange body with a decent size tan head. The aroma is quite fruity with notes of orange zest, plums, biscuit and caramel. Taste of caramel, raisins, orange zest, bread, roasted malts and floral hops. Very nice beer.

Erittäin runsaasti vaahtoava, tummanruskean/kuparisen värinen olut. Hajussa siirappia. Jälkimaussa hieman kitkeryyttä/kuivan katkeraa. Karamellimainen ja kohtalaisen kevyt. Verrattavissa saman panimon ESB:hen.

500ml bottle. Pours a dark chestnut colour with a persistent creamy head. Aroma is very powerful, with lots of spice, dried fruit and an alcoholic kick. Flavour is more subdued, with a smooth fruity body with a little spice drying out the finish.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

A bottle from Jasons near NCCU in Muzha, drunk at home. Aroma: delicious, caramel. Appearance: beautiful dark mahogany, minimal head. Palate: full-bodied and thick, soft carbonation with a long finish. Taste: heavy, quite sweet, this is Christmas cake territory, very complex. As the Beer Hunter himself said perilously easy to drink.
A very full beer and extremely drinkable given the alcohol content. There is certainly a sense of drinking a christmas pudding here but it is all beautifully balanced. Fullers make some great beers!
Bottle @ home, split two ways. Bronze clear pour with a generous head. Notes of toffee, toasted malts, nutty, some light syrup and sweet malts.
Excellent English beer. Puts other "real ales" to shame. Big chunky caramel and toffee malts, sweet and subtlety bitter. Some spice, dried fruit, banana. Superb. Best traditional brewery in the UK.

the aroma is malty and fruity with hints of toffee, brown sugar, dried plum and milk chocolate... the taste is fruity and caramel with notes of toffee, bisquit, dried plum, nutmeg and some spicy herbs... sweet, bitter and dry aftertaste...

Kopparfärgad, klar. Maltig doft med hö och gräs. Smaken är maltig, knäckig och välbalanserad, Jag älskar strong ale och denna är utmärkt.
Provning De Klomp 14/5 -06
Loafy aroma, full-bodied. Burned surgar. Sweet licorice. And hops. Well-balanced.
Klares kupferfarben mit reichlich Schaum. Malzig, süßlich, Röstaromen, Karamell, Nüsse, leicht fruchtig, süffig.
Clear, dark brown colour and some tan lacing. Rich malty aroma, hops, spice. Rich in flavour, malty, a little bit bitter. Mouthfeel is soft, medium carbonation. Nice and rich ale.

Copenhagen 28/6 2016. 50 cl bottle from Meny. "1845" in nice curving letter on the label. Very gushing upon opening making a mess on my kitchen table. Pours reddish amber with huge off-white head. Settles as thin layer of foam with lacing on the side of the glass. Aroma of dark fermented fruit, alcohol, roasted malts, nuts and a little tartness. Light carbonation and oily palate. Taste is sweet and rich forllowed by sour notes. Aftertaste is tart and lightly acidic. Leaves a nutty taste in my mouth. A very fine specimen - which reminds me of an brown ale.
UPDATED: JUN 15, 2016 Sabor e amargor marcante com notas dd café...cor marrom e encorpada. Foca entre uma bock e stout....
Bottle from saveur-biere.com. Dark orange to brown color. Persistent beige head. Medium sweetness and bitterness. Medium body. Aroma is caramel, vanilla, chocolate, hops, herbs.

Bottle. Amber, small to average mostly diminishing head. Moderate malty sweetish aroma, light caramel and faint roastiness with faint notes of dark fruit, light herbal hoppyness. Body is medium to full, malty, lightly sweetish - sweetish with light - some caramel, faint fruitiness/dark fruits and light herbal hoppyness. Finish is average, malty and lightly sweetish - sweetish, light - some caramel, faint roastiness with faint fruitiness/dark fruits, light - some herbal hoppyness, faint alcohol. Nice strong ale. Bit too much caramel for me - not overly too sweet.

Aromas a chocolate y caramelo
Baje aspecto caoba con carbónatacion correcta
En boca caramelo y chocolate con un final amargo suave

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

500ml bottle at home. Copper colored, small beige head. Aroma of caramel malts with dark fruits with some hoppiness and spices. Notes of alcohol also present. Brown sugar also there. Medium to heavy sweetness, light to medium bitterness. Very balanced, I also like the carbonation.

500ml bottle. Clear dark amber brown colour with a two finger beige head, good lacing. Malty aroma, dark fruits, I get the fruitcake aroma they claim too, also hops. Flavour is malty, fruity, and a hoppy bite to it, basically what you expect from the aroma. Dry and hoppy finish.
Not a usual style choice of mine but I can see why this gets good ratings. Good stuff.
Overall: Sweet, apple, bread, hay, grass.Note: Bottle 500 ml at a De Klomp tasting. Reviewed 2016-05-14.

UPDATED: MAY 7, 2016 Botella 50 cl tomada en el momento en el Lupulo. 12..04..2016. (r1729). Gracias Adri.... Color bronce rojizo caramelo turbio con espuma beige. Sabores espesos maltosos, caramelos y frutos pasos. Cuerpo medio algo pastosos y denso con ligero amargo final. Bastante buena.

500ml botle from Jumbo Costanera Center. Pours a mysterious dark copper color with a big tan head that shows good retention and laces perfectly well. Aroma is strongly nutty, malty with subtle hop presence. Strong notes of chestnuts, walnuts, earth, a touch of flambéed fruits, caramel, raisins and dark sugar. Fine and fairly elegant. Taste is quite bitter with golding hops battling the strong malty character. Dark full-grain toasted bread flavors with loads of nuts, raisins, caramel and hints of earthy and herbal touches. Body is medium but the carbonation is unfortunately too high to make this one outstandingly good. Low alcohol presence. A beautiful and well crafted English Strong Ale, flavorful and elegant.
Bottle. Nut brown with small head. Aroma is malt, nuts, raisins and caramell. Taste is the same. A complex beer with a fine lasting bitterness.

Aroma: caramel, but it was something in, that I didnt like it.
Appearence: reddis brown color, nice rocky head
Tast: medium bitterness, light sweetness, 
Palate: medium body, bitter aftertest.
Overall: That day tried 4 beer. This was the best.

Pours copper red with medium head. Aroma is caramel, toffee, honey, blackberry, sweet fruits, grapes, sweet cake. Taste is quite same, toffee, honey, some caramel, grapes, some bitterness, raisin. After reveals some coffee and oak. Very good beer!
Bottle. Copper color. Aroma of malt, ripe fruit and caramel. Taste has sweet malt, cake, ripe fruit, biscuit and some bitters. Quite nice, cakey indeed.

Bottle 0.33l at Samo pivo tasting Belgrade Serbia.01.04.2016.Taste with Ogi,Boban and Vlada ciaooooo.Pour it hazy brown color with small white head.Aroma sweet malty.Taste grainy,sweet caramel,quite macro filtered commercial taste,but ok decent and easy drinkable.

Botella. @El Lúpulo Feroz, Oviedo 16/04/2016. BBD:02/07/2017
Color ámbar, sabor caramelo, malta, dulce cuerpo medio.

500ml bottle @El Lúpulo Feroz, Oviedo. 6-04-2016.BBD: 02-07-2017. In short: malty complex ale.  Pours hazy cooper with frothy off white head. Moderate head retention, some lacing. Nose is malty, licorice, caramel, bready, toffee. Medium body, average carbonation, crispy texture. Taste is malty, sweet, little roasty, toffee. Good.
50cl bottle at home. Clear golden with a medium white soapy head. Light to medium body with moderate carbonation. Nice bitter and sweet tones. Citrus, caramel, malts, herbs and spices. Nice!

Originally rated on 7/28/08. My first beer from Fullers was a good one. Flavors of fruit, spices and sweet bread were wonderful with a rich maltiness, that was balanced by a slight bitter bite. It was a rich, flavorful and complex beer, very creamy and smooth. I wish I had another one, certainly worth a try.

dark reddish brown color, fairly clean. Crown ivory-colored foam formation and good retention medium. complex aroma with notes of dried, candied fruits, raisins, nuts, sherry, chocolate and caramel, as if it were a Barley Wine. Aroma also surprised by the presence of hops, giving it a good dry touch inside the supremacy of malt. The palate also surprise hops with salty nuances and a strong base grain, roasted malt, caramel, dulce de leche with an excellent profile similar to almonds. The end is bitter and sherry. The body is sturdy but not heavy, quite oily, carbonation is medium.

Look: clear dark red.

Aroma: bisquit, toffee, toasted bread, spicy hops.
Taste: moderate to strong sweetness balanced with hoppy spicy bitterness.
Flavour: toasted bread, toffee with chocolate. some overroasted bisquits.
Bitter-sweet aftertaste.

Very good.

The deScription "a rich beer" is certainly accurate. Its really a "dessert" beer. Christmas cake, fruit cake, nuts, orange marmalade, orange juice, wood, sweet spice, caramel, toffee, hot cross buns, smoke, and on and on. Good for winter, a bit too much for a warm autumn evening.
10-Mar-2016-0,5L Flasche. Rötlich-mittelbraun, minimale Trübung, beiger Schaum. Aroma: Feige, Sherry, Karamell, Rosine. Antrunk: malzig, Karamell, Feige, gegen Ende ansteigende angenehme Bitterkeit.

Bottle 500ml. Served at room temperature. Pours a hazy amber. Head is off white, dense and mostly lasting. Aroma is of earthy hops, orange marmalade, berries, caramel, biscuits, cooked butter and some light toasty notes. Flavour is a medium earthy hop bitterness with oranges, dried nectarines, berries (red), buttery caramel, biscuits (dry) and earthy/woody notes in the finish. Medium bodied with light carbonation and a good length finish.

Aroma: Floral
Aperance: Amber orange
Head white minimal
taste: Bitter medium heavy


Overal not my beer of choice

Review based on the BJCP2015 guidelines (style 17A). Bottle 50 cl - Batch 183. AROMA: predominant malty and sweet aroma with moderate notes of toasty, caramel, slight bready/cookie and molasses with a faint roasted background. APPEARANCE: dark amber color and translucent. medium, light tanned head, creamy, with moderate retention. FLAVOR: malt flavor dominates with moderate to high, toasty, caramel. Medium-low to low earthy hop flavor with medium-high bitterness that lingers beyond an almost dry finish. Balance towards malt and no esters perceived. PALATE: medium-low body with medium-low carbonation. no astringency. slight alcohol warmth. no creaminess. OVERALL: a very nice British Strong Ale with a lot of malt presence but with a good supportive bitterness. As improvement, needs a little more body and esters.

Bottle, home, really surprised that I havent rated this one. Acquired from Morrisons Supermarket in Chelmsford. 

Poured into Moor glass. Big white head. A pretty red and orange glow. Very nice strong ale appearance. Aroma is of fresh bread, aniseed, old socks and dried fruits. 

Taste is big and bready, huge malt bill. Lots of good Goldings. Slightly overkill on the crystal but the Simpsons pale is superb as always. Lovely big bready texture. Prunes, figs and stonefruits as well. Burnt blackberries on the finish and a tad hot on the finish but otherwise a great old skool English Strong Ale.

Pours a beautiful dark ruby color with very small white head. Smell is sweet and boozy.

Medium to full body with aggressive carbonation. Taste is combination of sweet and bitter. Caramel, malts, biscuits, fruits, alcohol... nice and smooth. Finish is fruity and alcoholic. Lovely cake-like aftertaste.

Overall, great strong ale. Loved it!

Id say Fullers deScription of a fruitcake aroma is pretty accurate, and the taste is a bit like cigar tobacco. Definitely an interesting beer, but maybe not one I want to drink too much of because the taste is a bit esoteric for me.

50CL bottle(bottle conditioned)
 pours a copper colour with a white head that barely lasts
 Aroma is virtually nothing just bit of grain
 taste is sweet bit of fruit no bitterness very thin for abv
 overall a very moderate beer,very old fashioned,try once

Appearance- dark amber/ruby, clear, a foamy off-white head which leaves lacing. Aroma- raisin, port, fruitcake, treacle, caramel, dark fruits, boozy hints, nutty. Smells rich. Taste- lots of sticky dark fruits, treacle toffee, honey-soaked malt loaf, crisp hoppy undertones, cherry, sugary raisin and plum, Christmas cake. Bitter finish which is strong and a bit boozy. Very good.

deep amber red color with an astonishingly huge fuzzy off white head.aromas of malt,esters,caramel.the body medium.the taste is bitter,malty,spicy with a long aftertaste that burns the throat.alcohol can be sensed a lot.carbonation is low, which is great

This beer has a fantastic amber color and a good head. The aroma is slightly fruity. And the flavor is fantastic with hints of oranges and a slight sweetness ending of with a fantastic bitterness from a great sort of hop. Nothing less than a fantastic beer.

Bottle from Sainsburys. Lovely deep reddish amber colour, white foam. Another beer heavy with house character, marmeladey hops, really quite a lot of bitterness here, and some full sweet bready caramel malts. Lots of flavour, well balanced, I think better so than the Golden Pride. Superb.
Butelka 500ml. Ciemno bursztynowy kolor o obfitej bialej pianie. Chlebowy posmak z dodatkiem chmieli owocow muszkatu lub orzechow. Goryczkowo chmielowy finisz.Ciekawy przyklad strong ale.i
*Old rating. Best before 01 Feb 13. The beer is round and malty. Nuts. Caramell, roast on a great Ale-typical body. Round and great!
Flaske. Farven er rødbrun og skumkronen er lysebrun og holder i meget lang tid. Aromaen er karamel og rosiner og smagen er æbler, rosiner og ristet malt.

Look: Poured into a Duvel tulip. Three finger light brown head which seems to last forever, light brown caramel color body.

Smell: Toffee, raisen, honeycomb, baked apple, pear, butterscotch pudding.

Taste: Light fruits (apple, pear), raisen, waxy honey, and big roasted peanuts at the end.

Feel: Medium high carbonation, briefly sweet upfront, medium dryness and slightly bitter at the end.

Overall: Extremely good, but I wish the flavor was a bit stronger.
Amber with thick beige head, lovely malty and creamy aroma. Complex flavors -- spices, a bit bitter, yet still creamy. Thickly carbonated, palate is a bit harsh. This is tasty!
Pours ruby/amber. Large dense tan head. Lots of sweetness and malt in the aroma. Rich nutty flavor which extends well into the finish. Medium body. Quite good.
An okay ale that does not succeed in hiding an apparent flavor of alcohol. Besides this there are some really nice toffee flavors from the malt.

Tea nose. Clear rust, firm and lasting medium tan head, nice lacing. Tea and copper, with toffee accents. Clay finish. Medium body, easy carbonation. Nice British character without being cloying and boring.
Bready malt aroma, with dark fruity flavours, and a spicy booze finish. Still good
from 500ml bottle this is a rich tasty beer full of caramel malty flavours with spicy hoppy fruitiness all coming through well very nice
Bottle. Brown hazy liquid. Lower carbonation. I have felt caramel and some cinnamon in aroma. Good.

Clear beautiful bright dark Amber with some golden hues. Aroma is fruity tea like hops with some medium crystal malts. Flavor is same earthy hops with a nice subtle toasted touch. Medium palate ,, very enjoyable.
Clear amber color with creamy beige head. Aroma is fruity, caramel and alcohol. Taste is medium bitter, dryish. Excellent in balance. Very good beer.

Klar, brun bärnstens färgad, ljust khaki lite orange skum. Doft: Malt, lätt lätt rostat, fruktkaka, lite jenka, äng. Smak: Malt, lite kaffe/rostat, äng, torr sockerkakskant, lite tuggummi, mörk nötkola.

Pours a deep mahogany colour with a thick creamy head with medium retention. Raisins, dry fruits and a gentle herbal hoppiness. Generous fruit cake on the palate. Moderate sweetness which fades into a good amount hop English hops. Very smooth, finishes on the dry side. Simply excellent!

Bottle from Meny (Amager), Copenhagen - pours dark sienna red with big persistent beige head. Aroma and taste is sweet malts with some nutty and spicy nuances going on, caramel and toffee cakey sweetness, pretty decent overall.
1/24/2009 3:50:24 PM Bottle in London. Dark red body. Hoppy nose. Taste of fruits, hops, chocolate. Quite strong and warming.
Pours Amber with a white head. Aroma of malts, raisins and grain. Taste is dried fruit and malts.

500 mL bottle shared by ebone1988. The pour is a dark amber with a nice off-whiteout gray head with some good soapy lace and a nice lingering film. The aroma is is full of caramel malt with a nice light sweetness that comes off a little fruity. Malt and caramel are really on the forefront here. Pretty basic though. The flavor is pretty bitter up front. There is a lot of toasted malt and a little bit of a metallic tendency. The fruits are subdued and the bitterness and the malt comes through pretty solidly. The mouth feel is light and there is a nice carbonation. The aftertaste is lingeringly malty and bitter. Not too shabby at all. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle shared with koleminer20. Aroma is caramel malt, bitter, decent. Appearance is rust brown, light brown head. Taste is caramel, toasted malt, bitter, burnt toast. Mouthfeel is decent, medium carbonation, medium body. Overall, it reminds me a lot of an ESB, which is not horrible.
Bottle 0,5 home. Quite big creamy head and dark amber color. Nice malts aroma, a little honey and caramel. Flavors are malts (a bit burnt), caramel, yeasty. Good complex and dry finish.
Malty, bready flavours. Some liquorice lacing. Some vinous, raisin dark fruit flavours too.

Ambar-rojizo con transparencia, espuma baja poca retención. Malta maltoso caramelo moderado alto, licoroso moderado, melanoidinas, lúpulo terroso bajo, ésteres a ciruela negra. En boca malta maltoso caramelo tostado moderado, licoroso moderado, lúpulo terroso moderado, amargor moderado, excelente balance. Final licoroso-amargo con una ligera astringencia. Buena carbonatación, con cuerpo, grandiosa cerveza
Âmbar escura com média formação de espuma de boa duração. Notas maltadas, caramelo, madeira, discreto "melaço" e lúpulo cítrico. Corpo médio com final longo, adocicado e de pouco amargor.

Bottle from bjcp course. Pours copper with lasting off white creamy head. Good clarity, limited bubbles with nice lacing. Caramel, toast, butterscotch, raisin, dark fruit, cherry, bread Slight spice notes. Grainy barley aftertaste. Full body with light carbonation. Slick on tongue. Some warming on finish. Great example of style. Really enjoyable.
Rica, se sienten notas de caramelo, bajo aroma a lupulpo, buen color y agradable en boca

Bottle. BB Jul 2016. Pours a very dark yet clear coppery amber, with a nicely retaining and lacing creamy head. The nose is toasty, nutty, with a touch of caramel. Tastes nutty dry, herbal bitter - much more bitter than Golden Pride -, and toasty, with a hint of autumn fruits. Good strong body, modest thin carbonation. Really nice soothing warmth in the throat. Id say its more characterful and unique than Golden Pride (which felt like a weakish barley wine). A good one.
Red in colour with a small head. Aroma of red fruits. Sweet taste witj red fruits and malts with a touch of bitterness.

Nose is dark malts, toast, muted. Taste is strongly licorice, malt, prunes, vinous, raisin berry.

I am a bit baffled by this. I could only really get licorice out of the flavour which I wasnt expecting.

Bottle 500ml. Pours dark reddish cooper hue, with a tall foamy light beige head. Mouth feel is oily with a medium body and light carbonation. Scent of dark malt, dark caramel and honey, hops. Tastes somewhat sweet with noticeable bitterness that balances it well. Slightly acidic. Flavors of dark roasted malt, caramel, vegetal hops, slight burnt caramel (from the malt), yeasty, breadth, lightly herbal with some licorice. Very good, interesting, complex flavor, nice balance.

Roughly frothy ale smells very vinous of fruit. It is a strong ale, which was made to celebrate brewerys 150 anniversary many years ago, but have happily been brewed since. It has almost aromatic character of a barley wine with clear signs of plum and raisin. The taste is only slightly malty with hints of good English hops, a little English licorice stand out and replaces the short-lived soft fruit again most resemble the British barley wine. It is a very complex beer to rate, for it has so many nuances that in the big picture just signals English brewed masterpiece. I really like it.

Bottle. A,ber orange, clear, with a high, fine,mfrothy head. Malty nose, chocolate and treacle, earthy hops, very rich and almost slightly funky. Sweet and malty, very rich malts, chocolate, caramel, bread. Dry, hoppy finish a rather remarkable beer. Very original.

Bottle - clear copper with large frothy beige head. Pleasant constant malt / smoke aroma. Ok on tongue - slight fizz on back of mouth - low carbonation.Full malted taste, rich boozy with toffee finish.
Caramelized malt and light hops. Clear mahogany pour with OK head. Consistency slightly syrupy. Light sweet finish. Some leather and toffee. Bottle.
Bottle. Clear reddish maroon color, beige head with good retention and solid lacing. Nice aroma of lightly toasted fruitcake. Taste has raisins, cinnamon, dark fruit. Very tasty.
Süßer Geruch nach Schokolade, Karamell und Sahnetoffee. Geschmack vergleichsweise bitter, aber auch Schokoladennoten und Karamell.
Farbe braun. Geruch nach fruchtigem Hopfen und Bergamotte. Im Geschmack ausgewogen. Bitter zum Ende. Leicht seifig.
Rich malt, fruitcake, booze, really good example of the English strong ale style.

Bottle 0,5.
Caramel aroma. Well balanced taste, semi-sweet, caramel & malt notes. Good.

Beautiful deep copper colored, soapy small to medium off white head. Aroma is malty, sweet caramel, toffee and biscuit. Taste is moderate sweet caramel, malty, biscuit, toffee, some fruits (fruitcake), bit toasty, low to medium bitter herbal hops, dryish finish. Medium bodied, moderate- carbonation. Very good!

Bottle. Pours maroon, with a cola coloured head. Aroma is caramel malts, with burned sugar and nits, as well as some spicy hops and clove. Full body, with soft carbonation. Flavour is spicy hops, followed by roasted malts with burned sugar, iced coffee and notes of leather, oak, aniseed and nuts. Bitter coffee throughout the finish.
%00 ml bottle at home. Nice copper color with small head. Some caramel and toffy in the aroma. Malty taste with bitter finish

Pite na koniec terminu przydatności. Lekki gaszing ,kolor miedziany, piana bujna, średniopęcherzykowa, lacing. Aromat suszone owoce, słodowe, biszkoptowe, śliwkowy likier. Smak to głównie słodowość. Finisz długi wytrawny, goryczka ziołowa lekko zaznaczona. Wysycenie wysokie, ale gładkie...
500ml bottle from Bochka in Moscow. Pours dark amber with a small off-white head. Aroma is caramel, toffee. Rich taste of caramel, spices, oak.
loads of caramel, ,toasty ,bready goodness. Fruity, malty and dry, lovely ale.

From a cask at a british pub in NYC.

Light smell of fruit and malt. Pours golden/brown mix. Light sweet caramel with some bitterness to help. The bitterness evolves the beer from a sweet treat with no backbone to something you can enjoy and savor.

Excellent.

Bottle (50cl) from Vinmonopolet (Ullevål Stadion), Oslo. Chestnut brown colour, slightly hazy. Half-inch off-white head that reduces to an uneven bubbly film with a narrow band of lacing. Aroma is malty and vegetal, with spiced cake and dried fruit, aged character. Medium body, soft carbonation, pleasant palate. Well-balanced, fairly sweet, malty taste with some fruity acidity and mild bitterness. Finish is malty and dry.

L:
-pours a clear copper with a big,frothy,white head
-medium carbonation visible
S:
caramel,orange & grapefruit peel,toffee,grassy,strawberry,slightly bready
T:
-Follows the nose plus a dark fruit (Raisins,Plums,Figs) character
F:
-medium carbonation,medium-full body
-smooth
O:
Fantastic English strong ale
Tasting at Plonk. Mild sweetness, some toffee and caramel. Somewhat low carbonation - it is English, after all. Id like to have more of this and rate it again.

Pours a clear dark amber, with a small, but dense white head. The aromas are caramel, dried fruits, prunes, spices, wood, earthy, and sherry. The taste is very sweet, but the finish is dry. The beer is mildly effervescent, and the body is above medium full.

Fruity aroma with spices, fruitcake, raisin and sweet herbal hops. Flavor of caramel, fruitcake and spices! Delicious!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Знакоми& специал& была цель. Понрави&
nice, slightly sweet and malty aroma. good hop balance with a little bitterness and bark like mouth feel. a little spicy, and a solid flavor. good one.

Malty sweetness and a classic English dry aroma come from this cloudy deep Amber brew. A very typical slight sweet medium bodied taste ending with a nice dry bitter aftertaste. Earthy flavors. For an English brew it's spot on.

Bottle from Waitrose in Whiney. Deep amber colour with a frothy cream head. Not much aroma, but plenty of flavour. Caramel and toast with toffee and stewed fruit. Rich and full flavoured. Great traditional ale.

Bottle @Old Joint Stock. Appearance: deep amber colour with decent beige foam. Aroma: caramel, spices, wood, fruity notes. Taste: lots of malts, caramel, wood, red fruits, spices. Not too sweet. Medium body. This is surely one of the best beers Fullers has ever made!

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 Butelka, warka do 09.05.2016, na szybko: jesli to jest najlepsze RB piwo w tym stylu, to ja nie lubie tego stylu chyba... karmelowe ciastko, nieprzyjemna, ziolowa nieco goryczka, jakas przyprawowosc tez wyczuwalna. Ciezkie. Ocena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).
caramel, bread nice sweet malty,golden, off white foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, creamy, soft carbonation, nice bitter and harmonic beer.

Clear dark amber, strong beige head. Roasty, nutty caramel aroma, some raisin notes. Medium body, sweet and roastily bitter, notes of nuts, raisins, maybe sherry. Finishes roasty, notes of nutmeg and roastiness. Very nice!
How : bottle Appearance : amber with a small white head. Aroma : lots of spice, caramel, fruits, some citrus. Palate : medium body, soft carbonation.

UPDATED: FEB 12, 2017 Deep amber-dark brown clear colour, with big firm mousse-like off-white head. Soft visual carbonation. Aroma with gentle notice of an alcohol, dominate notes of caramel, oak, cherry, apple, bread and honey. Taste is similar: with gentle note of an alcohol, sweet, with fruity-herbal-floral notes and dry bitter finish. Malt sweetness is high, hop bitterness is medium and they are very well balanced. Carbonation is soft, body is mouth coating.
This beer is absolutely one of the very best from Fullers brewery, and for sure one of the best from its style.
Origin: Bottle. Vessel: Pint Glass. Supplier: The Cambridge Arms (Bristol). Burnt woody taste with bitter tones.
Flavorful and dry. Spicy and malty with a hint of bitterness. Nice peaceful copper color with weight and good carbonation. Refined beer.
Pours a dark brown with an off-white head. Aroma is malt, caramel, coffee and citrus. Taste is medium sweet leading to a citric finish.

UPDATED: AUG 3, 2016 Hazy deep amber color, big tan head. Aroma of caramel, malt, dark fruits. Taste is the same with some honey and biscuit notes. Medium body, average carbonation. Very pleasant malty sweetness, not too sweet at all. Solid amount of bitterness in finish. Very nice.

Butelka. Barwa ciemny bursztyn, klarowna. Niewysoka kremowa piana, nietrwała, ładnie zrobi szło. Aromat trawy, kwiatów, ciemnych owoców (śliwka), karmel. W smaku m.in. orzechy, śliwka, rodzynki, gruszka. Goryczka wytrawna niewysoka lecz zauważalna pozostaje na długo. Alkohol dobrze ukryty. Bardzo ciekawe piwo, fantastyczny balans smaków.

Dark red color, clear, beige thin head. Aromas is caramel, bread, biscuit, some dark fruits, maybe cinnamon. Taste is sweet, like a fruit cake. Raisins, bread, nutmeg. Sweet aftertaste. Medium body with low carbonation.

Poured from 500ml bottle. 

Clear, orange-red-brown with a small khaki head and very good lacing. 

Aroma of spices, fruitcake, plums, raisins, caramel and marmalade. 

Taste of, spices, toffee, plums, raisins, dark fruit, licorice, mild chocolate and nonspecific bitterness. Indeed, the bitterness gives a nice balance to the rich malty and fruity flavors. 

Medium/full body and medium/low carbonization.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Amber colour, frothy head with decent lacing. Intensive aroma of toffee, spicy finish. Medium bitterness. Good, but nothing spectacular.

Bottle. Brown-red, medium off-white head. Minimum carbonation and lacing. Aroma malt, hints of honey. Medium body. Taste bitter-sweet, butterscotch, apricots. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours nicely, very nice deep reddish colour. Not too foamy and very nice sweet fruitish taste.

Brown ales and strong ales are basically not my favourite kinds of beer, but I must admit that this one gave me pleasure as a winter warmer. Lots of nicely balanced roasted malt, plum, raisin sweetness with spices. Very satisfying and filling. To be enjoyed slowly and not too cold. I have always rated Fullers highly as a brewery and this brew only adds to their reputation as far as I am concerned.

Bottle from Waitrose.

Pours a deep mahogany in colour with an off white head. Aroma of roasted malts, dark fruits, biscuit. Taste of initial roasted malts, some biscuit too, then dark fruits, licorice, touch of spice, lovely finish too. Great body, steady bitterness through the beer, finish of light bitter fruity taste. Very good!
Bottle from Booths, Media City. Copper-red with a small head. Theres chocolate in its nose, with a nice chocolate-malt flavour in its taste.

Pours a clear, deep mahogany with a light tan head. The smell is dark roasted malt, licorice, dark fruit. The taste is rich dark malt, licorice, some spice, dark fruit, molasses ending dry and rich. Medium bodied with a fine carbonation. Overall, a nice rich beer with a lot of flavor.

I was a bit disappointed with this one. I love nearly all of the Fullers beers and this one is so highly rated, but it just wasnt for me. Far too sweet. Indeed it tastes like a fruit cake, but I didnt enjoy that. The alcohol is hidden, but I definitely wont be coming back to this one any time soon.
Bottle at home, 15th February 15. Pours deep brown. Aroma is spiced fruit cake, some black treacle. Taste is fairly rich , some spice, caramel, black treacle. Pretty drinkable stuff

Bottle, found accidentally underneath the bottom shelf (on the floor) at a local crap-beer store, covered in dust, no idea how old it is, but best before September 2012! Lightly clouded light brown with a medium-coarse tan head that fades a moderate rate. Aroma is white raisin, prune, sweet pear, desert bread, toffee. Body is medium-medium-light, oily-watery, slight grit. Flavor is light toffee and raisin bread, some apple juice, bitter grasses in the finish, slightly astringent unfortunately.

Bottle 500 mL. Malty aroma, brown color with almost no head. Fullers just doesnt dissapoint, very nice beer and im not into strong ales. true to the style, clean malty caramel taste with a strong bitterness, very mild fruity taste, silky sensation. just a fine malty beer. loved it.

(Bottle 0,5l)
Aroma: Toasted malt, hops, light spicy.
Appearance: Light brown with floating yeasts. Medium beige head.
Taste: Medium sweet, medium bitter, caramel, light fruits.
Palate: Medium body. Long bitter finish.
Overall: Good English ale.

Bottle, 500 ml from Pivoljub, Ljubljana. Pours amber with creamy off-white head. light fruit in aroma. Sweet, malty caramel, light fruit. Looking other reviews not sure if something was wrong with it.

UPDATED: JAN 30, 2015 Dark, amber in colour with a thick, creamy tan head. Roasted aromas intertwined with hints of fruitcake. Full bodied with a rich, dried fruit taste up front, followed by a toasted, bitter finish.  A well rounded beer, but too much of a roasted flavour for my personal taste.  However, the roasted flavours give way slightly to sweetness as you drink it.

Bottle that Justin shared- cheers! Deep amber with a middling white head. Good rich mouthfeel. Grain harvest taste up front followed by a smooth fruitiness- sweet blackberries maybe with some raisin notes. I think I was expecting something barley wine-ish like their vintage ales, whereas this is more like a souped-up bitter, so I was a little disappointed. Nevertheless its still a jolly good beer- just not quite up to what I expected from the reviews on here.

Pours dark caramel with small tan head out of bottle. Aroma of caramel, biscuits, and bitterness. Flavor similar to smell. Good bitter. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
It looks great. Taste is all about a heavy load of caramel balanced by a heavy load of bitterness. A very fine, very amber ale, though not for me.

Pours a clear, deep mahogany with a light tan head. The smell is dark roasted malt, licorice, dark fruit. The taste is rich dark malt, licorice, some spice, dark fruit, molasses ending dry and rich. Medium bodied with a fine carbonation. Overall, a nice rich beer with a lot of flavor.
Bottle. Caramel, caramel, caramel - aroma and taste, as well as palate. Full, some burnt sugar. Nice though not too exciting.
Aroma is sweet crystal malts, caramel and fig. Taste is sweet slightly roasted malts with a very faint trace of plum and raisin. Transitions into a slight bitterness that is very well balanced.

0,5 l bottle. Clear, dark amber with a thick, creamy, tan head. Aroma of plums, caramel, candy sugar and coffee. Sweetish taste of plums, caramel and candy sugar with a bitter finish of coffee in the end. Medium to full body, creamy mouthfeel, flat carbonation. Very good but not brilliant. The coffee in the end dampens too much of its fruitiness. Moaning on a high level though.

Hazy reddish brown color, minimal off-white head. Sweet caramely notes, fruity tea bag. Taste is also caramel, fruity, bit alcohol and wood. Boozy. Some sweetness and bitterness. Bitter finish. Medium body, soft carbonation, creamy. Not bad. (Pivoljub 0,5l bottle)

Pours an amber color, topped with a decent tan colored head. Malty aroma, roasted, with some caramel notes and some little alcohol. Taste is sweet, roasty, some caramel notes and bitterness in teh finish. Slight alcohol notes in the aftertaste. Ok, not that bad.
Bottle. Amber, cloudy, frothy, tan foam, medium bitterness, medium sweetness, medium body, oily feel, average carbonation, & bitter finish.
UPDATED: JAN 8, 2015 Very typical English pale ale beer. But Marked and Strong. Shows high personality and impregnated pub aroma like.
Cask at the Hanging Bat. Pours ruby, nose is sweet toffee,caramel, taste is peppery, sweet, berries.
Pours hazy brown with minimal white head. Cognac aroma, a bit roasty, caramel, toffee. Well ballanced taste. Very good.

Bottle @ De Tolly Joogipood. Pours amber with small head. Aroma is sweet, caramel, dark riped plums,Taste is medium sweet with some bitterness, burnt caramel, bit watery, apricot. Medium body.Summertime beer. Woth to try.

Cask at The Hanging Bat. Clear amber body with a beige head. Nice lacing. Aroma of earth, wood and nuts. Flavour of orange marmalade, wood, toast and caramel biscuit. Medium body with an oily texture. Light carbonation prickle. A lovely beer, like a quality Bitter but with the aroma and flavour dialled up.
Caramels, nuts, toffees, a bit of dark fruity character. Really nice drinker on top of great flavors. Just a very, very, very good beer in all ways.

Bottle. Aroma malty, caramel, liggt roasted, typical English. Clear amber to brown colour. Moderately stable head. Taste is quite sweet, malty, caramel,light roasted. Some hoppiness, earthy. Moderate bitterness, but still much more sweet. That ratio lingers even into the finish. Overall good English strong.
Bottle thanks to sarkynortherner. Brown thin head. Aroma is fruity caramel malts taste same well balanced some alcohol nice bitter finish. Decent body. Good stuff

Pours a nice amber / orange with a one inch white head. Smell is slightly metallic with caramel and English hops. The taste is surprisingly hoppy but in a smooth and gentle way: lots of orange marmalade mixing with the slight chocolate and caramel from the malts. Its not particularly bitter but it has a tingly hop quality to it that gives way to caramel and malts. Very drinkable beer from Fullers.

From 0,5l bottle, BBD: 21 OCT 15. Pours deep hazy dark reddish brown liquid, big frothy tan head, Aroma: strong candied fruits, raisins, vanilla, warming alcohol, Christmas sauerkraut soup with charcuterie, walnuts, Taste: medium sweet, medium bitter, dry, fruity, raisins, caramel, malty, Palate: medium body, creamy to oily texture, soft carbonation, long bitter sweet finish, Overall: very good one, aromas are much richer than taste, body is not so full, but texture is excellent. Perfect drinkability.

Bottle. Full and intense beer filled to the brim with biscuits and fresh, slightly citrusy hops. The residual sweetness is countered by a slightly chocolatey bitterness. Immaculately balanced and dangerously sessionable brew. Fabulous!

Ambrée limpide, grosse carbo, collet fin et persistant. 
Aromes très caramel mais relativement faible. 
Palais assez mince et a nouveau très caramel. Amertume sur final assez long.

500 ml bottle shared by Huhzubendah, thanks Matt! Pours a clear dark caramel brown with thick white head that leaves sticky lacing. Aroma is sweet malt, brown sugar, and a nutty complexity. Flavor is same with medium body, moderate but ideal carbonation level, and a nutty sweet finish. Solid.

Bottle of 50cl.
Very nice and strange taste because of her complexity (caramel and roasted, and sweet too), helped with very nice palate and colour.
One of the best beer ive taste (in her kind).
Cheers !

Dark brown with great tan head. Good lacing. Aroma is loads of toffee, spice, prunes and English fruity yeast. Round and sticky palate. Aftertaste is rich, fruity, spicy, caramel and some noble hops. Overall: As good as English ales gets.
"not strong for a strong ale, but very smooth and quite flavorful. slight spicy, fruity hints play with the overriding malty goodness. recommended beer..."

UPDATED: DEC 15, 2014 500ml bottle poured in a chalice
A: Beautiful bottle art. Nice and imposing Fullers style. Also beautiful amber color with a beige head formed when poured. Small retention but many lacings left
S: Sweet and fruity smell. Caramel and malts are evident. Notes of brown bread and grapes. A bit of citrus hops in the end
T: Very malty and Brit but also fruity. Bit sweet upfront followed by quite citrus hoppy end. Absolutely easy to drink. Impossible to imagine its medium ABV
M: Medium body. A bit molasses. Medium to low carbonation. Delicious bitterness
O: Great Beer
[ BA Review @ 8/21/2011 ]

Bottle 0.5l. Clear amber witn medium beige head, nice lacing. Aroma of cherry, honey, malty, some caramel notes. The taste is as the nose, balanced bitter-sweet flavors, a bit woody. Light carbonation, medium body. Semi-dry sticky bitter aftertaste.
Oh this is good, plenty of tastes, a good kick and a snazzy looking bottle. Couldnt drink too many of these though. Savor and enjoy!

Bottle - red with a frothy and rocky light brown head. Aroma of chocolate, roast malt and grass. Taste of roasty malts, tar and toffee with notes of earth and grass coming through after and an ending of cocoa and medium bitterness. A little hint of alcohol, which isnt unwelcomed. Medium body, low carbonation.

caramel, brown, hazy, tan foam, very bitter, medium sweetness, full body, creamy, soft carbonation, bitter, 

some people might like this stuff a lot its palatable but to much for me i dont know if its the strength or the strong fruitcake smell i dont know but im not keen

Bottle conditioned. Glowing amber, slightly hazy, poured with a beautiful head leading to lovely lacing. All the superlatives used in previous reviews are justified and Im not going to plagerise - go deeper with this beer; close your eyes, its the beach, theres sea spray coming off the breakers and you can smell the sand and scrub grasses. This beer is an amazing triumph of brewing expertise but its more than that, its a total sensory treat.

Bottle - pours brown with an off white head. Caramel/burt sugar, nuts, plum, dried fruit. Sweetness up front, lots of plummy fruitiness. Mellows into a dry port like finish, which feels like its coated the tongue. Nice velvety mouthfeel. Nice beer!

Bottle; dark amber pour with a thin off white head; sweet aroma with dark fruits, caramel, malt, and a hint of spice; sweet taste of caramel and malt with hints of dark fruits, nuts, and some spice; has some coffee bitterness in the dry finish; very nice complex beer that is pretty easy to drink.

Bottle. Deep reddish brown, clear. Good sized head, light tan colour, small bubbles. Head fades quick. Strong sugar / caramel aroma, like pear drops. Fruity. Initially the sweetness and bitterness is balanced, but the stronger bitter taste comes through more prominently in the aftertaste. Fruit and spice in the initial taste, strong dark chocolate in the aftertaste. Decent punch from the alcohol too. Very good quality and very nice to drink.

Flaska från @thaalcoholic, tack! Dimmig bärnstensfärgad vätska med ljust skum. Karamellig söt doft. Stadig karamellmaltig smak där sötman balanseras väl. Den lite högre alkoholhalten passar mycket bra.

500 mL bottle from SoHo Organic Market, Elizabeth City, NC (best before March 25, 2015). Brownish-orange pour with a frothy khaki head. Aroma of light chocolate, graham cracker, and faint citrus. Taste offers smoke, roasted nuts, toffee, chocolate, and very faint tangerine. Pairs well with cheddar and Gruyère. A perfect example of the style.

pours unclear richly bright amber-red with a small creamy light beige-reddish head showing some retention and a nice lacing. fruity, woodsy, nutty and spicy malts/hops - incredible malt/hop bill, specialty malts, red fruitiness - some berries, cherries, bit of toffee w/o being caramelly not buttery, green coffee beans, fruitcake spices indeed, bitter chocolate, pepper, clean english yeast - nothing off and leaving way for malts to express themselves freely, soft earthy notes, hint of sweetness, grass. moderately low carbonation, light to medium body - oily but never heavy, lightly astringent and assertive grassy-spicy-peppery-earthy finish. balanced. like a masterfully crafted strong bitter. very good!

Bottle from greens and in my most rated beer mission. Nutty almond and caramel aromas. Big sweet candi sugar flavors. Molasses and nuts again too. Way better than Sam smiths and something I would get again pending other options. Nice drink.

Strong ale celebrating the 150th birthday of the brewery in 1995. Refermented in the bottle. Creamy, beige, irregular foam leaving pretty lacing, bright copper colour; assertive aroma of raspberry, strawberry, sweet cherries, caramel, flowers. Complex fruity and malty taste, mouth-filling bitterness of toasted malts, refined, nutty, long and very dry, very satisfying finish. One of their best.

Aroma frutado e adocicado. Coloração marrom avermelhada com excelente carbonatação e boa formação de espuma (boa retenção da mesma). Sabor levemente adocicado e com boa torrefação. Retrogosto amargo e com lembranças de café. Ótima opção de cerveja.
Beautiful malt aroma. Cloudy ruby red colour with excellent head. Toffee malt flavour up front with bitter hop finish. Medium to heavy body with medium carbonation.

bottle. Amber with two finger head. Caramel malt base, a bit sweet with some hop bitterness in the finish. Its an easy drinker, but not overly flavorful or unique. Not bad at all, but certainly not what I expected for such a highly rated beer.
bottle at a bar. poured a deep red to brown colour with a off head. malts, red forrest fruits, coffee, raisins, nuts, citrus, chocolate, ok beer.

Bottle, 500ml. A chestnut beer with a medium size creamy head and some lacing. It has a roasted aroma of dry fruits, spices, caramel and alcohol. Taste is bitter, slightly stronger at the end. This beer is somewhat dense, yet I find it drinkable and warming. It has a strong aftertaste with a malt character.

Bottle, 500ml. Clear reddish copper with a creamy beige head with foamy lacing. Spicy, roasted aroma, with hints of dry fruits and toffee. Rich and smooth, with flat carbonation. Deep spicy character and pleasant dark maltiness, with a heavy alcohol and bitter finish. Very drinkable, but definitely on the strong side.

Clear dark copper, stable offwhite head. Aroma has malt, toffee, dried fruit and alc. Flavour is similar with boozy/vinous notes. Quite complex and well balanced. Finish is spicy and boozy, a little rough perhaps.
One of my very favourite English ales out of a bottle. Complex, strong, and balanced. Would live to try from cask.

A rich, malty, fruit cake of a beer with complex dark flavours that explore the mouth. Smooth mouthfeel. One for after Christmas dinner.

Rated by BrewTom
Smellbis pleasant, resembles citrus. Pours medium dark with little head. Taste is excellent, with medium carbonation and a pleasant, not dry aftertaste.

Aroma has caramel, nuts. 
Flavor is smoothly roasted, nutty. Coffee notes.

Aroma: caramelo y cafe. Apariencia: color ambar oscuro, pocas burbujas y poca espuma. Sabor: entre dulce y amargo. Paladar: cuerpo medio textura un poco cremosa con un final un poco amargo. En general: buena pero por el mismo precio se pueden encontrar mejores. Salud!!!

Bottle. One finger thick fast head, some lace. Bit hazy, deep red brown. Dark complex aroma, dark chocolate. Good balance with strong tastes, juicy  fruit cake. Excellent!-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Dunkle Farbe, leicht rötlich. In der Nase sehr komplex: Kaffee, Rosinen, Früchte, Schokoladen, Malznoten und Brotnoten. Am gaumen Kakao, Karamell, Rosinen, Früchte und lang anhaltende, mächtige Bitterkeit.

- 500ml bottle
- Colour: deep red
- Head: thick when poured bit quickly disappears
- Aroma: chocolate, malty smell
- Taste & Texture: Very tasty, not too heavy; not too light; just right!!
- Verdict: would drink again. Best beer I've drank in quite some time!!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Malt and cocoa (dark chocolate) aroma. Amber color, beige head, persistent. Great lancework. Sweet at first then long bitter finish.
pours a redish amber with a slightly beige head. Aroma is malty, some roastiness. Taste has a lit of malt. a nice balance and full body.

Vörösesbarna színű ital kemény habbal és pörkölt illatokkal. Kakaós, étcsokoládés, tejkaramellás és némi földimogyorós, pirított karakterű ízjegyeinek sokasága nagyszerű harmóniában áll össze egy kerek egésszé. Az idő múlásával egyre jobban kitárulkozik, így téve intenzívebbé és gömbölyűvé a felsorakoztatott ízeket, melyek sorát a komló támogató jelenléte zárja.

UPDATED: APR 6, 2017 Original 09/06/14
Bottle, 500 ml. Pours deep, slightly cloudy ruby with a minimal amount of light tan head. Big caramel malt presence in the aroma, backed up by some fruiter notes (dark fruits and citrus) and a bit of breadiness and honey. Taste of roasted malts, salted caramel, bread, dark fruits, apple, citrus (tart-esque) and some grassy hop notes. Quite sweet as a result but this is balanced well by bitterness from both the roasted malts and the hops. Carbonation is moderate and the beer has a medium to full body, so this has quite a bit of weight to it. Combined with noticeable alcohol, this does not make for easy drinking, but the flavour is extremely rich and full so that is scarcely an issue. Very impressed. 

Update 06/04/17
Head is longer lasting and lacing is thicker than previously noted; fair bit of visible carb (medium sized bubbles) Like this one even more these days now that Ive got a regular supply again; noticing some subtler sweet and spicy notes in the aroma now; muscavado, candied sugar, clove, allspice, cinnamon, candied orange and dried dark fruits, dark rye bread and hint of almost roasted malt coming through right at the back. Theres a dry, earthen twinge to the taste I didnt notice before, which balances out the sweeter notes. Also more spices here including clove, nutmeg, and tingly black pepper in the long, drying, mildly bitter finish. Not as much booze as previously thought. Almost grainy tasting/feeling. Silky smooth with a subtle tickle of carbonation. Just a truly fantastic beer.

Bottle sample from backlog notes. Pours a clear brown color with a medium sized off white head. The aroma and flavor had sweet caramel malts, brown sugar, toasted bread, a very mild spicy character, earthy bitterness and grass. Light to medium bodied. Decent, but I wouldnt revisit this.

Bottle, 50cL. Home. A clear brown orange beer with a large thin beige foam. Long persistence. Beautiful lacing. Roasty smoky aroma with caramel, fruits (blackcurrant), herbs. Heavy refreshing smoky bitter and medium sugary sweet. Medium body, silky texture (but not oily), average carbonation, dry bitter finish, light sweet note. Overall, a great beer : intense hoppy and fruity character.
Pours a nice amber color with tan head. Dark fruits, spice, and some biscuit on the nose; follows onto the palate. Finishes with some sweetness.

Bottle thanks to allmyvinyl. 
Appearance - dark amber to chestnut with some lovely red chinks. Nice fluffy head. 
Nose - tonnes of toffee with some stewed apple. 
Taste - more honey than toffee but still a toffee note all the same. Some ginger cake too with a marmalade finish 
Palate - medium to full bodied with a big tangy texture and a nice bitter and tangy finish. 
Overall - yep really enjoyable.
karamellbrun farve med beige skum. Lukt av karamell og malt. Smak av karamell, malt og frukt. Fruktig og bitter. Vinmonopolet.
#100EN Gud duft av plomme og frukter, duft minner litt om portvin. Dunkel rødbrun farge. Tynt lag skum. Noe bitter med en smak av frukter. Et nydelig øl å sitte og kose seg med.
Great looking ale with a nice amber color, but it gives a metallic aftertaste and has a funny aroma, I dont really like it. I had big expectations for this ale, but it kinda let me down.
Pours clear dark amber with a medium tan head. Nose is caramel and wood. Aromas are caramel, roasted malts, plum, treacle and dark fruits. Strange metallic aftertaste.
500ml from Total Wine. Dark copper color with creamy white head. Not much by way of aroma -- sweet and a little breast, I suppose. Taste has some caramel, toast, hint of dried fruit.
Tesco deal. Poor aroma, weak and acidic. Brassy metallic taste. A little over carbonated. Not for me this one.
Bottle 50cl. White layer disappearing. Dark red brown color. Not too carbonated. Aroma is cherries, plum, oak and malt. Taste is forest berries, prune, malt, caramel, sugar.

Clear, dark copper body with a light tan head that ends up as a fully covering film and lots of lacing. Rather strong aroma that is... eh... boring. And sweet. Caramel and dark dried fruits, and thats about it. But its the mouth that counts, and on the palate this is an unusually pleasant drink: its got a delicious creamy and smooth texture with a fitting soft carbonation, the body is medium. Quite strong flavour of dark dried fruits, toast, caramel, herbs and bitter orange marmalade in the moderate bitter finish. Moderate sweet initial taste. Tasty stuff, too bad the aroma is weak. 
[50 cl bottle, enjoyed 18 months before BB date, from Vinmonopolet Ullevål, Oslo]

A dark copper colour with a dense creamy head. The aroma is both fruity and hoppy, and the taste is rich and appealing, dominated by fruity and spicy hints, including fruitcake, dried raisins, muscovado sugar and nutmeg. A truly complex and satisfying beer, with a long, fruity, but dry, finish.

Couleur intéressante, sans être fabuleuse. Belle mousse pour une Anglaise. Une première bouche caramélisée qui tire sur un goût presque fumé qui colle au palais. Pas mal, mais trop bien notée à mon goût

Bottle at home from Saintsburys. Aroma is nice dried fruits, raisin, nutty malts, with some mineral and co2. Dark amber copper colour with a lasting dense cream coloured cap. Flavour is composed of rich fruit cake, unrefined sugars and hint of roast in the finish. Very smooth and drinkable for the abv. Palate is full and rich with moderate carbonation. Woody bitterness lingers. Very tasty.
Bottle at home. Clear amber red medium pale brown head. Aroma is malty, tobacco, some citrus. Flavour is malty, treacle, a little dry. Not bad
500ml bottle from Vinmonopolet. Small creamy tan head. Clear reddish brown body. Aroma is fruity, malt dominated, caramel and cloves. Mostly sweet on the tongue, aftertaste of coffee.

500 ml bottle. Clear, amber body with a moderate sized, dense tan head. Mild aroma of malt, caramel and a bit nutty. Flavor is malty, some caramel, toast, hint of dry fruit, nutshell and moderate bitterness. Medium body and average aftertaste. Totally OK, but I have never let myself completely captivated by this one.
Pours a murky chestnut with an off white head. Aroma of coffee and soapy hops. Taste is initial hop bite with lasting coffee bitterness.

0.5L bottle. Clear, dark amber with nice beige top. Raisin and fried bread aroma. Old wood, light caramel, bitter citrus seed, white bread, overcooked sugar. Good bitter finish. Mild toffee and bitter mouthfeel.
500ml bottle, Dark amber brown colour with off-white head. Aroma of roasted malt, coffee, and hops. Strong coffee taste with some nuts, roasted malt, and chocolate, as well as a nice hoppiness.
Rich and complex blend of fruits, toffee, chocolate and hops on the nose, with sweet creamy alcohol notes on the tongue. A great ale.
Tåkete rødbrun farge med beige skum. Lukter mørk stenfrukt og kirsebær. Medium fylde og noe søtlig og krydder i smak. Bitter/tørr i ettersmak.
not my thing at all i knew it wasnt going to be but i thought i would give it a try maybe in the future i will give this style a go again but at the moment its not for me

DAA; Pours dark amber with a lasting, leaving lacings, creamy light tan head. Aroma is light roasted malt, sweet dried fruity, caramel and light nutty. Taste is sweet, light bitter and spicy. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.
Wow what a brew good from the top down, hard to find sometimes but definitely a treat
Rødbrun litt tåkete med høyt beige skum. Karamell, malt og mild mørk stenfrukt. Søt karamell og brunt sukker, noe humlebitter. Lite kullsyre.
very well-balanced strong ale, exactly what you should expect from that kind of a beer - it has a strong taste. Little bit too fizzy at the beginning, but after 5 minutes, excellent ale!

3/27/2014. From bottle and a little past the best by date. Copper color with a tan head. Sweet malty aromas with caramel and spices. Bitter flavors, spices, caramel, hops, fruity. OK, but not my favorite.
Some slightly coffey notes. Fresh. But the body should have been more full. To conclude a dam good dram.
Fabulous caramel flavour with a deep finish. Complex taste, but still exceptionally drinkable. Cheers to the best brewery in the world !

UPDATED: FEB 9, 2015 Caramel, dried fruits, bread, grass, chocolate and nuts in the aroma . Mahogany with a off white head. Medium to heavy sweet and medium bitter. Medium body with a soft carbonation. Overall a really nice ale, pleasant aroma and good flavor with a body and carbonation that matches this brew perfectly in my opinion.

Bottle. Clear copper, big off-white head. Nose is toffee/pudding, berry, slight paper. Flavour is toffee with some dark fruit, paper, nice goldings hop finish with licorice. Ive heard that Fullers uses the same malt bill across their top pales, but here they leverage it and what do you get, just more toffee and licorice? Nice, but these English beers really shine for their sessionability, cant say Ive ever been a massive fan of the "strong" versions.

Ins Glas ergießt sich ein kupferfarbenes Bier mit ordentlicher Schaumkrone. Geruch röstmalzig, nussig, würzig, leicht alkoholisch. Geschmack röstmalzig, fruchtig, würzig, Karamell, nussig, alkoholisch.
Backlog. Tried bottled and on tap a couple of times. Matly with caramel, a slight bitterness and some dried fruits.
Brun nästan lite rödaktig i färgen med litet ljusbrunt skum! Doftar ganska syrligt och en del alkohol. Smakar maltigt men även tagit smak av fatlagringen!
caramel, red, brown, hazy, minimal head, tan foam, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, lightly bitter, medium body, lively, average carbonation, medium body,

Bottle 500ml @ home
Pours clear brown with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, caramel, yeast, dried fruits, bread and floral hops. Taste is medium sweet and light to medium bitter with a long caramel, fruity and slightly bitter finish. Body is medium, texture is thin to oily, carbonation is soft.
50 cl bottle. Pours hazy copper with a small white head. Malty and alcoholic aroma. Taste is sweet and dry. Nice ale.
Buenisima,a la nariz malta y una mezcla de fragrancias de hierbas y algo muy sutil de cafe,al paladar medio bitter lupulo pronunciado malta hierbas y cafe,recomendada
user_location: SANTIAGO DE LOS CABALLEROS, DOMINICAN REPUBLIC

text: Copper. A little bit of white head. Malt, alcohol, sugar nose. Caramel, malt, sugar, some alcohol, some herbal (bitter herbs) flavour. Bitter, some sweetness. Medium body, a bit below medium carbonation. Balanced, but not very interesting in my opinion.
A very cloudy ale, with a medium head, this medium-to-full bodied ale has a very complex malt taste, deep and rich, and it is fully hopped. Overall, this is an excellent ale.

Pours dark copper--nearly brown and somewhat cloudy from bottle conditioning. Thick, sweet malty body with strong, fruity English yeast character. Alcohol bite is present, but expected. A wonderful ale for a cold night.
Bottle from vinmonopolet enjoyed at home. Brown/red color. Not much smell. Taste is malty. Allround enjoyable ale.

Bottle, 50cl. Pours hazy, copper, red brown color with a fine, creamy beige head that leaves good lacing. Fruity, sweet malty aroma with notes of caramel, bread, butter, spices and liquice. Flavor starts out sweet and malty, with present of caramel, burnt sugar, toffee and dark fruits. Hobs, and light bitterness towards the end. Decent long finish with spices. Medium to full bodied, average carbonation, creamy, almost oily texture. Absolutely well worth its price tag.

Pours a hazy, deep copper colour, with a nice frothy cardboard colored head, that lasts long. On the nose there are fruity aromas, as well as nice caramel malt among other things. On the palate you can detect, the complex fruitiness, malts, caramel, toasted bread, and a nice slight sweetness. Another fullers masterpiece.

Mørk gylden med medium skum. Aroma av malt, mild karamell og muligens noe som minner om tørket frukt. Anonym, men god. Smaken er malt, noe karamell og faktisk litt bitterhet i avslutningen. Medium konsistens. Kvalitetsbrygg som jeg gjerne kjøper igjen!

A very fine Strong English Ale indeed, it smells of and tastes of a rich and intense fruit cake, yet with an earthiness that makes it a bit savoury and is absolutely delicious! Certainly one of the finer strong ales! I wish I had another!

UPDATED: FEB 14, 2014 Flasche von Getränke-Töpper, Berlin-Moabit. - Schönes Kupferrotbraun, das an Assamtee erinnert. Eher schwache Nase, nur leicht fruchtig-süß, mit einem Hauch von Erdbeerbowle. Vollmundiger Antrunk; schweres, volles Röstmalz mit Noten von Lakritz, Kaffee, Bitterschokolade und Feige (Früchtebrot). Ich vermisse etwas die fruchtige Note (Erdbeere), die ich von früheren Verkostungen in Erinnerung hatte. Sahniges Mundgefühl. Süß aber nicht sirupartig. Im Abgang sehr starke, erdige Hopfenbittere; lang anhaltender bitterer Nachtrunk. - Ein wuchtig-aromatisches und doch harmonisch-süffiges Festbier - großartig! Nur schade, daß die neuen Flaschen so häßlich sind ...
500ml bottle, pint glass. Copper red/brown. Mild aroma: malt and caramel. Smooth taste: light roasted malt, just a hint of bitterness. Very nice.

0,5L bottle BB 30.10.14. Pours red copper with nice white head. The head stays. Aroma is malt, caramel, licorice, fruits. Taste: is strong caramel, malt, sweet, creamy, burnt sugar. Finish has some nice burnt bitterness and ash. Overall: solid strong ale, but not really special.

50 cl. bottle poured in to a snifter. Dark amber colour with an orange tint. Dense, creamy off-white head. Good looking actually. Sweet aroma with caramel malts, a good fruitiness, spices, rich toffee, dark fruits and a note of butter. Taste is sweet. Medium body with a creamy texture and a soft carbonation. Finishes dry and fruity with spices and toffee. Excellent classic.

Caramel and toffee notes, followed by a mix of cooked fruits, jam, and raisin take a hold of your nose, and invite you to take a sip of this exemplary version of an English strong ale. All of the notes present in the aroma, are revisited in the flavor. The caramel and toffee flavors are only enhanced by the fantastic -almost cream-like mouth feel. The light toffee and dried fruits/ esters linger into the after palate, followed by the mild bitterness of the English hops used.

Purchased 500ml brown bottle, 6.3%, @Vinmonopolet, 2014-January.
Thick off-white to pale beige head, lacings there are. Bodys brown to dark amber, or mahogany.
Aroma; sweet, caramel malt, lots of spices too, and apple tart on top of it.
Taste; hops, roasted malt, sweet syrup, prunes, dried apricot, roasted almonds, chocolate. 
Well bodied. Aftertaste; the malts, soft bitterness, fading out into the nothern lights.
Overall very tasty, an ale close to bock, or close to porter. But still ale. Nice!

(Flasche) Es hat eine rotbraune Farbe, ist filtriert mit einer bräunlichen Schaumkrone. Das Aroma ist süßlich, etwas Erdbeere, Karamell und Aprikose. Der Geschmack ist eher schlank, leicht röstig, adstringent, aschig, harzig und bitter. Der Abgang ist bitter.
UPDATED: DEC 27, 2016 Pours a dark brown mahogany colour with a slightly creamy tight head. Aroma is sweet fruity spicy. Taste to follow strong warming rich sweetness and dry bitter balance.

Bottle from bier-deluxe.de. Amber brown color with medium off-white head. Aroma of roasted malt, coffee, herbal hops. Strong coffee taste with some nuts, roasted malt, chocolate, some fruitiness. Nice hoppy bitterness in long coffee bitter finish. Good.
Bottle. Clear dark brown with a frothy beige head. Nutty, grainy aroma, bitter nutty taste, a little chocolate in the mouth. Medium-bodied, carbonated, bitter and chestnut finish.

Bottle - Dec 2013 - BCA  Deep Ruby-Reddish Amber colour. Lively carbonation; deep head. Mega-Fruity (dark fruits, raisins, citrus-orange, fruit cake, peel) & spicy. Very Malty; (roast malts, toffee, caramel, burnt sugar). Earthy peppery hoppyness. Yeasty. Rich, slightly sweet, full bodied, strong ale. Dry bitter hoppy fruity finish. One of my regular go-to beers. Lovely beer!

Pours a warm dark copper coloured with a moderate head and moderate lacing. Aromas of minced pies with slightly spicy fragrances. Very subtle taste of caramels and even a hint of toffee. Balanced on the palate with a very short bitter finish. Brilliant beer!

500ml bottle, pours clear reddish golden brown with a small head. Very rich caramel & toffee malts, with dried fruit, figs, raisin, cherries. Finish is nicely balanced and short bitterness comes through. Palate is rich, thick and oily. Carbonation is soft. Nice.
aika pehmyt maku. Saunakaljana pihapelin jälkeen saunassa mainiota settiä. Kyllä se hyvin maistuu.

There is an aroma of caramel, raisins, bread, and other sweet ingredients. There could be a bit of vanilla as well. Its dark amber in color with a frothy, beige head. There is an alcohol astringent taste with bread and earthly tones.
One of the best bottled beers ever. Being bottle conditioned I drink this to capture the yeast for home brew purposes. One the the best yeasts ever.

UPDATED: DEC 16, 2013 Bottle. Light brown,clear. Bit of head. The nose is full of caramel/toffee from the malt, with alcoholic astringency. Smells like a higher ABV beer. Taste holds no surprises: sweet, with a bitter alcoholic finish. Solid strong beer.

Bottle from Tesco [111213]
Caramel ruby brown, clear, frothy off white head, some lacing
Aroma - rich fruity caramel malt, soft fruit cake spices, raisin, soft bready malts, dark sugars, slight rum
Taste - Soft sweet fruity caramel malt, raisin, some soft spicy English bitter hop, light toffee, rich flavour
Palate - Soft carb, medium body, very smooth texture. sweet caramel malts, soft spicy English bitter hops. Finish - light dry, fruity raisin malt, bitter spicy
Overall - Amazed I havent reviewed this before. One of the best Fullers beers.

UPDATED: APR 25, 2015 Amber colour, fluffy head. Perfect lacing. Aroma of caramel, dry fruit, spice, herbs. The body is medium to full whats the main advantage of this beer for sure. Smooth roasty sweetness and obvious biterness in taste. Fruity, too. Medium bitter long finish & aftertaste. No doubt its a highlight of the brewery. Very good.

Clear dark copper body with a fluffy well-lasting head. Nose has mild notes of caramel, syrup and herbs. Taste is bold with a sweet base accompanied by a caramelly sweetness and a minimally dry finish with some roastiness to it. Carbonation is soft and the palate is heavily rich and creamy.

500ml bottle from the brewery. Pours copper brown with a lingering white head. Aromas of cake mix, mixed spice, mixed peel, caramel, clove, stewed fruit. Taste has a rich sweetness, full bodied and creamy. Lovely spice bitter finish. Grand.

How: Bottle.
Where: Systembolaget.
Appearance: Dark red/brown colour with a beige head.
Aroma: Fruit, malt, caramel.
Body: Medium body and carbonation.
Flavour: Malt, fruit, some caramel and hops. Bitter finish.

Appearance: Clear copper/ruby with 2 finger thick ivory head.
Aroma: Chocolate malt, bread, umami, fruit cake, hay/grassy.
Taste: Low/medium sweetness and sourness, with medium bitterness and slight saltiness.
Palate: Thick rough texture, light/medium body, average carbonation, lingering astringent peppery malty, dried fruit, burnt, bitter sweet finish.
Comments: Tasty and glass lace.
Bottle. Pours clear dark amber to copper with thin tan head. Aroma is malt, candy, honey, hint of grassy hops. Flavor is malty, honey, hops, spices, grass.

Aroma: caramel, roasty and coffee malts. Appearance: dark amber, white frothy head. Taste: medium bitter. Palate: full body, lively carbonation, bitter long finish. Overall: great strong ale. Bottle from Sainsburys.

Bouteille 50cl.
Cuivrée-ambrée, col épais et crémeux blanc cassé.
Arôme est malté caramel, léger fruité; prune et date sur un malt cara pâle - crystal. Effluves houblonnées restent en retrait, malt domine sur une fine touche biscuitée et fruité noir en rétro-nasal.
Palais est malté, caramel, très anglais sur ce côté agréable biscuité. Le tout ponctué par une amertume modérée très anglaise, léger citronné - noble. Au final, un côté malté grillé léger perdure.

Pours a reddish copper caramel with a foamy two finger off white head with nice lacing. Aroma is of fruity esters, caramel, butterscotch, fruit cake, toffee, sweet malts, and some spices. Taste is similar to the aroma with the addition of some light grassy hops, lasses/burnt brown sugar, and rum. Has a medium-full body with a semi creamy mouthfeel and a semi dry, sightly bitter, medium-long finish. Overall, a very nice English Strong Ale that is a great winter warmer that isnt over 10% abv.

Ye ole 1845, why doest thou seem so appealing? It is better in concept than reality. I want to like it more but I just dont. Tastes of molasses and fruitiness with some biscuit (which I would rather have than the beer itself). That being said it is a must try, just not fully my thing.
Bottle. This is one of the best English strong ales I have had. Its got a a great depth of flavor and perfect balance.
This is a super Ale. Really lovely aroma, great taste and flavours, and looks great too. One of my favourites at the moment.
Dark reddish brown pour with a beige head. Muted aroma is nutty and sweetly malty. Malty nutty sweetness is comes and goes too quickly.

Nice dark red/brown color with good off-white head. Aroma of caramel and hops. Taste is bitter with sweetness in finish. Long bitter aftertaste. Good beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle brewed in England and poured into glass. Head is off white and is relatively thin. Color is dark (but very clear) reddish brown. Average body and carbonation. Aroma is malty. Slightly more bitter than average, with a hint of sweetness. Good beer, but not as exceptional as I had expected.
Murky Brown. Aroma is very light. Taste is more prominent - dark fruits, malt, nice yeast character. Overall, good strong ale.
UPDATED: MAY 18, 2015 A deliciously different brew that makes a refreshing change from the usual lager and/or pale ale. Only problem is - its too strong to enjoy in the quantity one would wish!
Pours a dark caramel colour with medium head. Aroma is sweet caramel and butterscotch. Taste is fairly sweet and bitter, with a slightly hoppy aftertaste that lingers for quite a while.
Poured from a bottle it is a an amber color with a slight head. The aroma is of raisins and the taste is of butterscotch which resinates on the palate with a bitter finish
From an imperial pint bottle shared in Avon NC. Pours a clear amber with an off white head. Aroma of caramel and butterscotch. Flavors of fruit cake. Smooth mouthfeel. Moderately bitter finish.
