Clear Oak with big of white head. Aroma of caramel and English hops. Taste of a nice English ale, caramel, nicely bitter

Bottle. Pours clear deep amber with a medium off-white head, good retention, nice lacing on the glass. Aroma of roasted malts, coffee and some light fruitness. Taste - moderately sweet fruity start, caramel, toasted malts, dry finish, bitter aftertaste, well balanced flavors. Medium bodied, good drinkability. Robust ale.
Big toffee and camel nose with earthy floral hops. Caramel colored with a cream colored head. Bitter with balance.
Fra flaske på Cardinaltreff okt-13: fruktig og velbalansert, en skikkelig god old ale hvor humlen suser diskret i bakgrunnen. Fullers skuffer aldri.
Unclear brown with off-white head. Aroma of very good ale, and similar taste. Can be drunk in small samples, or in decent.pints. A classic!

Mahogany brown with some red here and there, head leaves some lacing. Toffee sweetness, woody or oak aromas. Malty toffee, oaky rich flavor and hints of coffee and some bitterness at the end. Elegant and traditional.

Bottle @ home. Profumo di cereale torrefatto, luppolo ma non in dry hopping, lieve caramello. Colore ambrato carico, quasi ramato, schiuma beige chiara, molto fine quasi cremosa. Piacevole in bocca, il gusto è più intenso del profumo, ritrovo larmonia del caramello, del tostato e la luppolautra gentile. poco corposa ha un ottimo retrolfattivo, che me la rende estremamente beverina anche in una serata in cui prima avevo già assaggiato diverse ale. equilibratissima non ha sbilanciamenti di nessun tipo, il che forse è anche lunico motivo per cui non è perfetta: è un po banale.

Láhev 500 ml. Silné sladové aroma doprovázené karamelem a závanem alkoholu. Pěna je lehce hnědo bílé barvy, středně vysoká, hrubí konzistence a drící. Barva samotného piva přechází z rubínové do tmaví měděné. Chuť je znát po praeném sladu, příchod silné uhelné hořkosti je velmi rázný, to celé je zakončeno alkoholovým dozvukem. Toto pivo není příli dobře pitelné kvůli své robustní hořkosti, ale jinak svým vzhledem a chuti přesně podtrhuje pivní styl english strong ale.

BOTTLE 50CL.

Head: beige, medium, frothy, poor retention. Colour: chestnut, slightly hazy.

Aroma: rich malty, biscuit/cake, toffee, dried fruit, slight alcohol notes, old.

Taste: relatively sweet, toffee, burnt sugar, delicate fruitiness, moderate bitterness.

A good bed-time beer, to quote M. Jackson.

(Bottle) Clear rich reddish brown with good head. Excellent rich aroma of dried fruit and dark toffee. Full bodied with some stickiness and good carbonation. The taste has a rich dark toffee backbone. Theres plenty more going on. Theres some short-lived tangy flavours at the start that are followed by some developing complexity of dried fruit flavours and theres just the right amount of bitterness in the finish to round it all off. An excellent beer.

Caramel colour, slight white head. Sweet aroma, malts, honey, caramel and bread. Quite bitter flavour, bitter roasted malts, hint of coffee. Sweet finish, caramel, roasted malts. Quite nice.
(From 50cL bottle @ Gents Bier Festival. Thanks for sharing, 77ships!)
Bottle dark amber Body with light tan head. Aroma is malt with some dried fruit taste is first bitter then some malt with hints of coffee aftertaste is lasting bitterness with malt. Nice beer

0.5 bottle. Creamy, off-white head of great retention, leaves a thick and nearly uniform lacing; clear, scarlet color with a violet tinge to it. The aroma is mostly malty, there is caramel, bread and dried fruits. Quite bitter, hop taste, but again mostly malty with dried fruits, a bit of coffee and a tad of caramel. Medium body, slick texture and soft carbonation. Finish is long, dry and bitter, some of that tartness lingers in mouths cavities for a couple of minutes. Overall a pretty good beer but a bit more could be expected.

caramel, bread, spruce, woody, red, brown, clear, minimal head, tan foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, light body, slick feel, soft carbonation, bitter, long finish
Dark ruby brown with minimal tan head. Big burst of caramel and toast with dark fruit on pour. Spruce hops and burnt sugar persist. A mild bitter sweet taste with a bit of sourness. Carbonation is minimal, even after being served closer to room temp (cool, not chilled @ 10 degrees). A slickness to the mouthfeel and light in body. Finishes with a dry, slightly astringent bitterness. Bitterness lingers in the finish. Pretty decent overall.

500ml bottle. Clear dark brown-red amber colour, off-white foam head leaving some lacing and aroma of caramel, bread, dried fruits, musty. Taste is sweetish malt caramel, toffee with bready, earthy & dark fruity notes, and a lingering spicy bitterness. Smooth mouth feel, medium bodied, soft carbonation, dry fruity finish. Very drinkable.

500 ML bottle

Clear amber red color. One finger of light brown head, falls to a thick collar. Brilliant lacing. 
Nose is bread, toffee, dried cranberry, orange, banana, clove, and dates. Nice nose. 
Taste is pretty much the same as the nose but add in some slight metal citrus notes. 
Medium bodied, light carbonation. Complex beer for the ABV and that is good.

20/VIII/13 - 50cl bottle @ home - BB: 22/I/15 (2013-787) 
Clear red amber beer, big irregular off-white to light beige head, little stable, adhesive, leaving a nice lacing in the glass. Aroma: lots of dried fruits, prunes and raisins, toast, caramel, overripe banana peel, some mocha. Taste: toast, caramel, mocha, lots of dried fruits, hoppy bitter touch, some overripe fruits. Aftertaste: toast, mocha, little bitter, banana peel, cocoa powder.
one of fullers best beers...its based on an old receipe which is great to see and keeping to tradition...can intially seem sweet but onece you break your palate it realeases a world of taste

First impression is carmel, almost butterscotch. Follows with juicy malt and a mineral kinda bitterness. Understated hops, very British. Tastes more like a big ESB than a strong ale. A tasty change from my usual IPA hop onslaught
Bottled. Pours dark copper with a white head. Smells boiled vegetables, canned and malty. Tastes abit canned, boiled vegetables, stale grassy hoppy, spicy with a canned grassy hoppy finish.

Fullers 1845 has a very thick, creamy, cream-colored head and a murky, red-brown appearance, with noticeable tan, tiny and not-so-tiny, yeast chunks suspended from top to bottom. There isnt too much lacing, though. The aroma is strong- cellar mold, cream, coffee, nougat, old fruit, funky yeast, sweetness, and malt. Taste is of sweet, heavy bread crust, chocolate, nougat, cream, milk, yeast, straight-forward hops, bitterness, medium-roast coffee, and sugar. The mouthfeel is high medium and slick, and Fullers 1845 finishes sweet and rich. Overall, this is delicious, and I score it high. RJT

Bouteille de 500ml @Terre de Boissons. Bière ambrée au col épais voire crémeux. Au nez : fortes odeurs de malt caramel, amertume légèrement piquante. En bouche, forte saveurs de malt boisé due à la longue garde développant une jolie rondeur aromatique à la finale amère et minérale. Le palais est sec. On la déguste lentement et on découvre le bon malt le bon houblon la bonne eau sans que ce bel assemblage ne développe une expérience gustative spéciale.

50 cl. bottle sampled @ GBF 2013. Dark ruby amber with almost no head. Nose is sweet caramel and toffee good, bit watery with some iron, bread, light fruits, touch sticky dark fruits, Taste is a bit watery, some iron, toffee, caramel, brown sugar, faint dark fruits, brown bread, faint biscuit, Nearly flat and bit watery, I was hoping to enjoy this one more than I did. Thx! to the RB Crew for sharing.

@ gents bierfestival 
pours dark amber, almost no foam . smell is sweet, caramel . a bit old ( is this aged?? ) taste is pretty sugary .
Bottle. Mahogany clear. Nutty caramel malty. Green herby hoppyness. Body earthy, medium. Nicely bittered.-- bb/wp8

A refreshing change from everything I've been drinking lately.. Best enjoyed chilled or near room temp. Delicate aromas dark bread, dark dried fruit and mild spice. Full mouthfeel, with a soft, creamy carbonation and solid flavors of mildly roasted malt, raisins, dried fruits, dark bread and light caramel/molasses. Although the aromas are very delicate, the flavor more then makes up for the beers other shortcomings. Very enjoyable. While it is not the best beer I've ever had, it is a very easy drinking and satisfying beer that I will definitely be buying again for after a long days work. 

--- tasted while on a long journey to understand the world around me...
Bottle. Pours clear amber with a thick head. Aroma of matls and caramel. Taste is malty, hoppy and bitter without being sharp.

On sale for $1.99/half liter bottle, I should go back and buy cases! First impression is carmel, almost butterscotch. Follows with juicy malt and a mineral kinda bitterness. Understated hops, very British. Tastes more like a big ESB than a strong ale. A tasty change from my usual IPA hop onslaught.

27-JUL-2013, bottle @home, from Fish & Beer, present from Minitøserne, Thx:-)
Clear mahogany with lasting, creamy, tan head.
Aroma is caramel, bread, malt, nuts, fruit, dark berries, wood, and nuts. 
Taste the same. Hint of spices. Creamy with soft carbonation. Finish is bitter. Very nice ale.

Thanks to BalkanMac for bringing me a bottle from England. Dark ruby-mahogany brown, rich leathery fruit aroma. Surprisingly bitter dryness, over tart red fruit and caramels. Great fruity hopping, rich dark fruits. Good ale, warming dark and rich.

UPDATED: NOV 16, 2014 Pours dark brown reddish with nice beige cap. Aroma of candies and hops, piney, a bit roasted malt as well. Flavor is dominant bitter from hopping and darker malt with malt complexity, berries, candy and pine, as a background. Interesting one, cause differs from others I have tried, with roast tones. A bit alcohol pungent on nose too, but very mild. 
16.11.2014.- +1 in taste cause of flavor complexity, with every sip I liked it more and more, although the beggining was a bit maybe too bitter for such body, but then it becames milder and milder. Beautiful brew.

Dark amber color with 1 finger off white head. Aroma of honey, jam, nuts, fermenting fruits, cookies, caramel. Taste is light sweet, sour and bitter. Good balance. Light to medium body, oily texture, soft to average carbonation. Good

500 ml bottle into pint glass, best before 2/14/2014. Pours lightly clody reddish copper color with a 2 finger dense light khaki head with great retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lingers. Spotty soapy lacing clings down the glass. Aromas of big raisin, fig, caramel, toast, toffee, molasses, chocolate, brown bread, light roast, light nuttiness, floral, and toasted earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great balance and complexity of malt and fruity notes; with good strength. Taste of big raisin, prune, pear, molasses, toast, caramel, toffee, chocolate, light roast, brown bread, light nuttiness, herbal spiciness, and toasted earthiness. Fair amount of earthy bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of dark fruit, molasses, toast, caramel, toffee, chocolate, brown bread, light roast, and toasted earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Fantastic complexity and balance of fruity and malt flavors; with big robustness and no cloying flavors after the finish. Light-medium carbonation and medium bodied; with a very creamy and moderately slick mouthfeel that is nice. Alcohol is very well hidden with minimal warming noticed after the finish. Overall this is a highly excellent English strong ale! Big complexity and balance of robust malt and fruity flavors; and very smooth to drink. A highly enjoyable offering.
Brown, slight ruby appearance. Beautiful fruit cake aroma, Rich deep flavours with a long lingering slightly malty finish

UPDATED: MAR 26, 2014 500ml bottle date stamped "best by 7 Feb 2014" served in a Belgian snifter. 
Pours a medium brown-amber color with a sudsy khaki head that soon reduces to a partial coat and ring. The aroma suggests sweet baked fruit bread. The flavor also suggests bread and has hints of toffee but is dominated by pale and medium malts. Some spicy/earthy hops too, as is quite obvious in the finish and moderately bitter aftertaste. Slightly improves with warming despite the emergence of clear alcohol tones in the aroma. 
Medium+ body with light carbonation.
Strong and balanced. Light sweet, bread taste and great body. Despite the strong taste, it shows great drinkability.

Looks beautiful in the glass, thick, slightly cream, fluffy head. Caramel, roasty, sweet and sour smell. Tastes well roasted, sour and slight alcohol. A bitter and slight sour finish. Very nice, smooth and very low fizz. As it warms the flavours become more complex, fruits begin to come through, and the smell developes to something that reminds me of Christmas.

Amber colored with a ruby tint. Two fingers of head and good lacing. Aroma of biscuit malt with light fruity esters. Malt taste with some fruit and a slightly bitter and herbal finish. Medium body and carbonation. Nice drinking beer.

2013 bottle to a snifter. Red brown color with a small off white head. Aroma is malt, biscuit and fruity esters. Taste is slightly sweet with toast and an herbal quality. Little bit of a lingering bitterness. Medium mouthfeel with a dry finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Medium brown color a little bit of white head. Smells of apple juice, and some other sweet fruits or sweet jelly. Taste of light bitter with just a little bit of sweetness, grainy, finishes a little bitter with some cracker like quality. Not a bad drinker but smells better than it tastes. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Clear copper brown with a creamy light brown head. Aroma is mild with nut, caramel and wood. 

Taste is mildly woody amd nutty. Some sweet syrup. Bitter aftertaste. Some extra alcohol. Solething is a bit off with the combination, but this is still a warming good beer.

Bottle poured into Finnish pub mug. Pours a medium brown color with amber tones, with a finger khaki head that dissipates into a thin, lingering cap. Aroma is bread, fruit, light caramel. Flavor up front is toast, a hint of caramel, a mysterious fruity touch and some malt. The finish is long with a bitter slap at the very end. Medium mouthfeel with some effervescence. The beer is pretty solid, and Im surprised Im unfamiliar with the brewer. Would try again, though not worth cellaring.
amargor na medida certa, aroma ameixa preta e malte, densa, alcool sem sobresair, esquenta bem, licoroso

UPDATED: MAR 12, 2014 Clear mahogany colored beer with a huge fluffy big-bubbled blonde head dissolving quickly. Pouring in the yeast makes it hazy. Aroma has loafy maltiness and earthy herbalness as well as some chocolate and toffee sweetness. Judging by the aroma I could swear Im drinking a doppelbock. Flavor is bitter, sweet with raisin, toffee and chocolate, herbal and malty with slight coffee as well. Finish is quite long with intense bitterness, coffee and some alcohol as well. Palate is quite thick but lively carbonated. A decent beer which could almost go as a doppelbock in a blind test.
bottle. pours a dark reddy brown. Thin off white head and pretty lively. Malty, bready, toasty aroma. Nice and rich, toasty flavour - sweet, malty, some dark fruit and caramel. Tasty.
Gedronken bij dutchdrebus, speciaal uit engeland, rood/koper/bruin van kleur met een beige schuinkraag, licht bier, smaakt beetje caramel en droog

Bottle at home. 
Malty nose. 
Walnut color fine white head. 
Medium body small bubbles, nut flavors, nice hop flavor from goldings I guess. Nice ale. 


:)
Bolton Brew.

Poured from a 500 ml bottle into a brandy snifter. Pours a murky dark copper with a light khaki colores head of foam. Good retention and lacing. Aroma is of dried out, stale Graham crackers, prunes, and some cardboard. This beer has some obvious oxidation issues. Dry sweetness comes through in the taste, but the oxidation is quite distracting. As the beer warms it gets a little better, but never quite recovers.

The only thing that keeps this from getting a perfect score is that it is a tad too fruity for my tastes, but that is a very minor quibble. Another Fullers masterpiece. Fullers is not widely available where I am from. Pity.

33cl from Auchan. It pours a dark amber colour with a head that rapidly goes to a tan minimal one. Some floral, toast, bread and caramel notes on the aroma. It start with a light bitter taste that gets stronger and quickly disappear for a dry end. A very good beer!

Clear, medium dark amber, big, long-lasting head, streaks of lace.  Taste is clean semi-sweet caramel malt, joined by dried light fruits and toast.  The flavors mingle and grow to a smooth bittersweet finish.  Somewhat heavy for the abv, but still satisfying.  Recommended.
Full aroma with lemon and alcohol. Like a best bitter on steroids. Pretty sweet, long spicy aftertaste. Pretty good.
bottle from Costcutter, Brownswood Rd London N4.  Pours dark amber coloured with an off-white head.  Caramel and woody overtones in the taste.  Full mouth feel.

Bottle 50 cl. Pours amber in color with a small tan head. Leaves a nice lacing on the glass. Sweet toffee, some nuttyness and just a bit roasted notes in aroma. A bit dry. Slightly sweet notes of toffee and nuttyness in taste.
Bottle 50 cl. Pours Brown Copper With medium smooth lacing head. Wery Nice Taste of roasted nuts, reminds me slightly of altbier. Some sweet malts. Good strong ale.

I really liked this beer, liquorice aftertaste but not overpowering, a medium dark amber ale, but easily drinkable, honestly I could probably drink this most of the evening, a good bitter drinkers ale. For all though die hards, coats the glass well (yawn) beautiful dark amber notes (sleeping) tastes of caramel and liquorice overtones (am I still here) just drink
It, its  a bloody good English ale!

tough wait for this one to warm up outta the fridge... pours beautifully dark copper with solid off-white head. aromas of toffee malts as well as spruce and sweet herbs... taste is that again- the hoppiness of this beer surprised me. excellent balance and leaning more toward the hop. An english ale for hop heads. superb

(Bottle): Pours a clear dark amber with ruby tinges, small off white head. Lots going on with the aroma - lots of different fruits, maltiness, biscuits, bread, licquorice and caramel. Flavour is initially lots of roasted malts and fruits which lingers into a perfect bitterness from the hops all with undertones of caramel and chocolate. Theres also a definite presence, though hidden well, of alcohol. Fantastic beer.
UPDATED: DEC 14, 2014 From the archives: One of my favourite ales. 2 bottles for a cold winter evening... Updated: BBE 3/3/2016 Not as thick as previous ones. Still good though.

Bottle at home, from Tesco Ashford, 19/04/13.
Pours clear copper with a good sized frothy beige head that retains well.
Nose is toffee, background fruits, biscuits, malt, light spice.
Taste comprises rich caramel, biscuit, background hops, light spice, brown sugar, toffee apple.
Medium bodied with a bit of clout, fine carbonation, dryish finish.
A decent English strong.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle from local Alko, Helsinki. Colour is deep copper with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Sweetness, caramel, spices, toffee, chocolate and malts. Great beer.
a light red brown with a real light tan thick foam. Aromas are caramel, toast, dough, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, oily feel, full body, bitter,

UPDATED: NOV 24, 2013 Clear darker golden red, one finger top. Aroma has some hops, raisins and tastes the same. Difference with their ESB is, this is like local German house beer with a bitter taste that is not overwhelming.

Lowering the score because this does not fulfill expectations as its high mark suggests.

Bottle to Tulip/snifter glass, BB September 20/13.

Appearance: transparent brown-red color with a off white head that had disappeared quite rapidly. 

Aroma: Toffee, butterscotch, nuts, dark fruits, chocolate, caramel, spices. Judging from the aromatics, this beer might be past its prime. 

Taste: Lots of sweet, spicy, fruity notes. Slight bitterness at the finish. Lots of cookie/cake flavours. 

Palate: Smooth, I find it on the thin side. Not terribly carbonated. Pretty well balanced and alcohol is hidden well. 

Overall: Pretty decent brew. More in the flavour than in the nose which is cool.

On bottle from Vinmonopolet Vika.darkngolden color, good foam. Aromas of red fruits, malt, dried fruits- good aroma intensity. Light hop aromas. Medium/ full body & complexity. Sweetness, some balancing bitterness. Enjoyable
Smak och doft av humle, malt, plommon, apelsin, choklad, mörkt bröd, russin och humle. Fyllig, vinös och god sötma.
Bottled ; Devon ; UK ; Caramel,roasty,fruit and floral aroma ; Amber color with bigger head ; Medium sweet and bitter taste ; Medium body ; Long finish ; Pleasant ESA.

500ml bottle bought at Olivers Delicatessen in Central.
Clear reddish brown colour with trace of dirt-like yeast sediments; Two and a half finger head and crumpety off-white foam which last for 2 minutes; Excellent sticky lacing and active carbonation; Very fragrant aroma of sweet roasted malt, caramel, toffee, fruit cake, and grass; Pleasant, mid to light sweet taste of roasted malt, with burnt caramel, light liquorices, leather, spice, bitter lime and grass; Medium body and oily palate; Taste profile is initially sweet roasted malt with strong, colourful bite of herbal grassy hops in the background, accompanied by leathery yeast and notes of dark chocolates. Exotic! Hop bitterness is expressive, more like bites but never overbearing, with lingering and right dose of astringency to finish; Pretty dry after taste, pleasant and tempting to mouth.

Comments: This is absolutely an sensual opener. Just when I thought it may be an upped version of the fruity Old Winter Ale, its looks, smell and taste has characters all of its own - excellent head and lacing, sweet roast malt-driven aroma and taste, and a very lovely, exotic spiciness and hoppiness which can only be fully appreciated via nose and taste, not words. It may not be THE best English ale, but its pretty damn close.

Bottle. Hazy chestnut with a huge tan head. The aroma offers a load of prunes and dark chocolate. Very complex, fruity  flavour with notes of bitter chocolate, vanilla, nutmeg. There are some slightly alcoholic phases inbetween that made me think of aged rum. The finish is dry and endless, and makes for a good finale of this great brew.
Brown orange with medium lasting head. Taste round and full for its alcohol percentage. Aroma of barley and caramel. Taste of caramel, barley and malts.

This is everything that an English Ale should be! With a hearty aroma and a dark brown appearance it looks and smells perfect which only can be outdone by its rich flavor a perfect residual palate. Enjoy!

UPDATED: NOV 22, 2015 Limpido color rame con pannosa schiuma biancastra. Sentori di frutta, pane, caramello, cuoio e cereali; gusto in linea con latteso con note delicate di toffee e frutta sciroppata, più amarognola nel finale. Corpo medio, effervescenza debole, struttura setosa. Non amo particolarmente le birre inglesi di questo tipo, ma offre una discreta complessità gustativa e olfattiva.

3/23/13. Bottle. Best before 9/25/12. Pours dark brown with a fluffy, bubbly beige head. Aroma is vanilla, fruit, spicy, floral, caramel, biscuits, some leather? Taste is spicy, fruity, light, dry, vanilla, and again this unusual (to me) leather quality. Dry fruity finish. Medium carbonation. Bubbly, tickly mouth feel; somewhat chewy. Some lacing. Oddly refreshing. Incredibly well balanced. This turned out to be a pleasant surprise. I didnt think I would enjoy this as much as I am. Very nice.

Dark brown beer with a dark beige head. Some sweet fruit and bread in the aroma. Good aroma but not very strong. Mild sweetness and lots of grassy bitterness. Caramel, alcohol, leather. Strong hops but a bit one dimensional beer. Too sour for my taste.

Bottle, 500 ml, poured into an english pint glass. ABV 6.3%
Deep amber colour, with no activity in it. Two fingers of tan head, with very good retention. Nice lacing left around the glass as the foam goes down.
Aroma of roasted malts, caramel, a bit hoppy, some chocolate notes too.
Nice bitter taste, roasted malts, hops, and bitter chocolate.
Medium thickness on the body, average carbonation. A bit sticky on the palate.
Great beer, I could drink this the whole night.

Bottle. Pours brown-reddish, with white-yellowish head. Malty, bread-like  aroma; taste is a pretty even mixture of malt and hops, sweet at first, but finishes dry. Quite a decent body, medium carbonation. Pretty good, but maybe a little overrated.

UPDATED: AUG 27, 2014 Sep 2012 - another bottle.  Not much head, but froths in the mouth.  Slight sharpness of alcohol, which reminds me of some Belgian beers.  Good mouthfeel, mild with little bitterness. Every taste seems slightly different, but the overriding taste is that sharp aftertaste.  Like a better version of a Westmalle beer.

Not getting this tonight. Shit day. Long day. Enjoyed the journey there and back, liked the pie, chips and gravy, had some giggles but some damage done. Im going to work dressed as KC tomorrow and theres nothing Pebbles can do.

50cl bottle. Beautiul amber color with a huge but not too lasting head. Great refreshing fruity, malty aroma with some hints of alchool.Flavour is sweet, fruity, hoppy with a dry bitter end. Bitterness perists quite a while. Great beer
Cask Real Ale tasted at Kittys. Mild malty and hoppy nose. Pale beige thin head (2mm). Clear dark copper color. Malty roasty and hoppy taste with some sweetness and syrup notes. Hops bite at the end.
Bottle from Ocada; hazy dark brown with off white head, rich fruit cake aroma, rich malt taste with sugar spice, quite sweet with minimal hop.
Amber-red color with creamy ivory head. Caramel malt, toast, nuts and ripe fruit aroma. Light sweet at taste with fruit flavour and finish in dry bitterness.
Bottle from Sainsburys. Quite enjoyable, full flavour and that. Some treacle I think. Likes it.

16.9 oz bottle. Pours a pretty slightly hazy copper with a medium cream-colored head with good retention; leaves some groovy lace. Aroma is caramelly with some earthy hops underneath. Taste is toasty and caramel sweet with a little bitterness in the finish. Body is a little thin, mouthfeel creamy. Not bad, but probably the least impressive Fullers beer Ive had.

UPDATED: AUG 2, 2013 Clean dark amber color, big beige creamy head with sticky lacing. Sweet aroma of caramel malts, cookies and spices. Taste is sweet too, with dark fruits, malt, fruit cake, nuts, herbs and a lots of earthy hops in long finish. Full  body, velvet texture, soft carbonation. Nicely balanced and very enjoyable ale.
Clear brown color with light brown foam head. Aroma is pleasant bitter with tones of nuts. Taste is strong bitter malty, some fruit in aftertaste. A really good beer, this is. (Velp 201302)
Decent aroma, appearance, taste and palate, overall memorable. Rated from the bottle.

Color is deep amber plumb color tan pillowy head. Aroma is dark cherry fruity hoppy floral plumbs. Taste follows the aroma well. Nice hoppyness with a sweet malt backbone to balance it out. Very great beer and smooth!
Smells like biscuits and honey with a bit of bran muffin with raisins as it warms. Taste is malty sweet with some toasty caramel, firm bitterness that lingers.

Bottle from Mane Liquor. Pours red-amber with a small, fluffy white head. Nose shows light hops and loads of spice with earthy malts and rich toffee. Taste really showcases the spice. Not really my kind of beer. Had it with Nepalese food as I thought it might match it quite well. It did ok, it was just an overload of spices for the night....
Bottle at home. Clear reddish brown color, smooth white head. Light malty sweet aroma. Malty body, little hops, spices and sweetness.

hden suosikkipanimoistani panema olut kaatuu aromilasiin tummanruskeana ja isokuplaisella vaahdolla, joka kuitenkin katoaa nopeasti. Haju on vahvasti maltainen, pähkinäinen ja hieman karamellinen, se on myös melko vahva. Myös jonkinlaista metsäisyyttä (havupuun runkoa?) tulee mieleen. Maku on karamellinen, jossa keskivaiheilla pähkinäisyys hyökkää päälle ja se taittuu lopuksi vielä humalan katkeruudeksi. Maltaisuus ei omaan suuhuni liiemmälti tuntunut. Suutuntuma on keskitäyteläinen. Kaiken kaikkiaan maistuva brittiale, jollaista ei ole hetkeen tullut juotua. Sopiva alkusyksyn tai keskikevään iltaan/päivään, kesäolutta täyteläisempänä, mutta talviolutta kevyempänä.
Bottle. Rich amber pour with a frothy head. Nutty, earthy, spicy - this is really enjoyable! Looks great in the glass too.

Pours a dark mahogany color with a good sized head that slowly fades to ample lacing. Aroma of roasted malt, burnt coffee, dark fruits and spice. Taste is a mixture of roasted malt, some dark chocolate, dark fruits and some spice. Nice bitterness and a dry finish. A solid medium body, smooth with a creamy texture and an excellent balance. As it warms the flavor and character is enhanced. Great beer to start the new year with.

I first tasted this beer in 1995, or was it 1845? Cant remember but it was long ago. I didnt care much for the aftertaste at the time, coarse hops and very bitter. 

Jump on several years and the local supermarket has an offer on too good to miss. Bottle conditioned, 6.3%, Fullers - ticks all he right boxes so I thought Id give it another try. 

Well, what a beer, glorious! Real ale in a bottle. Massive fruit & malt, perfectly balanced, some citrus, yeast & burnt toffee. Theres something about the aftertaste Im not liking still but this dissipates slightly the older it gets. Nevertheless, this is an amazing brew by todays standards and one I cant imagine being without for so long ever again.
Mild aroma, nice deep dark color, seems to warm your taste buds with every delicious sip. Smooth after taste. Very satisfying beer...
This is an absolutely amazing premium ale and fortunately now available in the US.  Its not sessionable, but the complexity and flavour combine for an amazing post-dinner ale and experience

Medium chocolate brown ale with crimson highlights. Aroma of chocolate and caramel malt with hints of dark fruits, herb and bread. Medium bodied, oily and creamy with a flavor of chocolate cereal and fig. Finishes dryer than expected.  I like this beer, dont love it like the ESB.

Heavy aroma of dark roasted malt, alcohol, oak, nutmeg, and spice. Cloudy reddish amber color, some beige head. Very thin body with a dry finish. Some bite, not much. Some fruit, not much. Malt was delightful, but not as full flavored as I would have liked.

Bottle conditioned. Dark copper colour medium head. Aroma of dark fruits and sweet malts. Taste is of dark molasses, malts, dark fruit and butter. Smooth on the palate. An excellent beer all round. Would love to find on cask.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text: Bottle. Pours clear dark coppet with airy but stable light tan head. Dark aroma of malt, raisins and roasted coffee. Ditto taste. Perfectly balanced. Lingering, pleasantly dryish taste. Excellent. One of the best brews Ive ever had.
Big toffee and camel nose with earthy floral hops. Caramel colored with a cream colored head. Bitter with balance.  Medium full and warming.
Wonderful beer.  Aroma has got oranges, tobacco, dried out old barrels.  Sweet, sticky, very deep flavour.  Lovely finish.  Thick creamy head unlike anything Ive seen from a bottle.

Bottle shared.  Pours clear amber brown with an off white head.  Aroma of caramel, malts, toffee and raisins.  Flavour is moderate to heavy sweet and bitter.  Fairly full bodied with soft carbonation.
50 cl bottle. Dark brownish amber color and lightly brown head. Aromas of malt and fruits. Raisin and roasted nuts maybe. Taste has bitterness, but is well balanced.Good one.
Medium head, that holds for pretty long. Medium red colour. Yeasty, malty aroma. Taste complex with liqorice, a bit of wood and toffee in the finish. A very good strong ale.

Bottle from Ambrosetti, Berlin, Germany. Aroma of smoke and some wood. Pours sparkling, amber to brown color; nice, firm, beige head. Quite bitter, although nice, especially notes of walnuts and wooden barrel in the finish which lasts for a long time. I loved it, just my kind of ale.
Fullers best beer. Quite hoppy for the style, some lively carbonation. Some notes of cake, ripe, raisins topped of with a medium bitter finish. Lovely stuff
Ill go with a bit of spicy fruit cake, sounds a bit like D Loxton to me..............

Bottle at home
Rich fruit, deep ruby. salty, thick medium bodied, malty finish. Sweet orange and toffee apple.

Bottle @ Home. Pours slightly hazy dark reddish brown with a light brown head. Arom of malt, caramel, light fruity, grassy hops. Flavor of malt, caramel, wood, some dark ripe fruit, spice, grassy hops. Medium body, soft carbonation, bitter finish. 211012

Topside this has an easy good loose magnolia head which sends of waves of toffee. Orange copper brown appearance. In the mouth and to the taste there is an unfolding complexity of some castor sugary sweetness back and forth ending firmly with a dark dry gentle bitterness. A bit raw but juicy too and firm and that roastiness doesnt quite lead to into anything to stern. Doesnt at all appeal to my emotions but I can appreciate it for what it is.

50 cl bottle.
Originally rated on 20100205.
Pours dark copper color with a small head. Aroma of caramel, some toffee, malts and some wooden notes. Flavor of caramel malts, ripe fruits, toffee and mild alcohol on the background. Nice.

Pours beautiful dark amber, almost brown, with a creamy golden head, firm and enticing. Aroma of sweet malts, biscuits and the old barn scent, where fruits have been storaged among dusty bottles of brandy. Flavours of honey, malts, vanilla and fruits - the plums and sweet dried berries. Really well balanced with a touch of hoppy bitterness, which kind of spoils the finish in my opinion. It is an overlenghtened bitterness - and not the nice one, but quite a poor, nasty hoppy bitterness. ALMOST perfect.

500ml bottle. Biscuity, yoghurty aroma. Pours a large frothy off-white head. Taste is rich, spicy and with a strong hint of plums, with some mulled wine in there too. Medium carbonation. Aftertaste is not that far away from that of a fine peated malt whisky. What a wonderful ale and truly a delight to drink!

Bottle @ Home
The pour is clear, reddish brown. Ample carbonation and frothy white head.
Nose is dried fruits, cinnamon. Taste follows this, but is very rich. Malty sweetness. Lingers.

Bottle from one of the supermarkets. A clear dark brown pour with a thin white long-lasting head with some sticky lace. Sweet malty aroma leads into a lovely rich malty citrusy flavour with a hint of caramel. The combination of hops works well and sits nicely on the palate. This is a gorgeous, rich, refreshing ale that I really need to enjoy more often.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

The appears a beautiful shade of mahogany. Bubbles slowly ascend from the base of the glass. The head is nearly two inches thick, resembling sea foam, coating the glass with sticky lacing.

The aroma is of malt, toasted bread, earth, and a hint of fruit. The scent is enticing and inviting.

Fabulous flavor. I am instantly a big fan of Fullers 1845, and will make it a point to have this beer in my fridge on a regular basis. Delicious toasted malt and bread with a hint of earth and fruit. 

The feel is creamy and silky smooth, with spot on carbonation. Expertly done.

Overall, a superb beer, and deserving of its #1 English Strong Ale ranking.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 07-27-2011

Bottle. Pours clear rich amber with a large creamy tan head that has good staying power and great lacing. Aroma is caramel, toffee, raisin, dried fruit. Flavor is good, but less powerful than the aroma. Lightly sweet, lightly bitter on the finish, with notes of orange and grass. Body is medium.

500ml bottle - one of the few I havent sampled from the local Tesco Metro, Im surprised I left it so long. Pours a great rich brown, with a thick white head that lasts. A full fruity nose, lots of caramel, spices, Christmas cake. A syrupy mouth feel with the same boozy mouthful of fruit and winter spices. After taste nice and dry. Quality!

Bottle shared with MichaelBruch. Hazelnutbrown in colour, long lasting head. Aroma of grounded nuts, garlic and coffee. Taste of sweet espresso combined with maple syrup and bitter malt. Nice ale thats better when it has got some temperature.

Bottle shared with McTapps. Pours in deep brown. Nose is sour and grainy. Aroma of black coffee. Tastes like a bit black coffee and roasted malt. Definitely a quality beer but this one does not hit my preferences.
Strong butterscotch aroma. Although strong this beer is also very well balanced with loads of depth of flavour. A good beer by all means but personally I did not crave for more afterwards

Medium strong aroma is inviting: citrus hoppiness, butterscotch, nuts. Mahogany brown, clear, beige head leaves also lacing. Taste has malting on top dancing with hoppiness, good balance, medium body, long bitter finish. Great beer, pure enjoyment.
Boa. caramel, toast, roasty, resin, barnyard, woody, caramel, resin, caramel, caramel,
Bottle at bar. Red copper color, white head. Sweet taste with caramel, citrus, nuts and bread. Dry bitter finish. Very nice ale.

Pours a dark, ruby red/brownish colour with an off white head which stays somewhat. Lovely smelling beer, loads of malt, raisins and caramel. A beautifully balanced beer, a great, rich malt flavour that lasts, with a biscuit taste, raisins and some very slight spice notes. A superbly smooth mouthfeel, a lovely, bitter finish. A great beer!

Pour deep hazelnut brown, with a small light beige head.
Aroma of caramel, nuts, dark fruits, cereal, slight pine and grass.. (This has real mellow hop profile) with a really large malty backbone. 
The taste is quite sweet, with a bitter and slightly dry aftertaste.
Medium and rather oily body, with a semi-flat carbonation.
Fullers is always steady! Aroma is hoppy and hazlenuts.  Toasted malt, little bit of chocolate at the back, caramel and fruity.  Complexity.  ends well with nice lasting bitterness.

Dark brownish amber color and tan head. Aroma and flavor are rich maltiness and fruitiness. Raisin and toastiness are prominent. Reminiscent of a doppelbock.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

500ml bottle, bought in New Zealand. Pours deep brown with orange highlights, cream coloured head which laces the glass. Aroma is sweet walnuts, orange, plum, wood and a big waft of traditional christmas pudding. Taste is sweet with warming alcohol notes, chewy caramel with a subtle bitterness. Carbonation is smooth with a caramel malt finish. Lovely.

UPDATED: NOV 28, 2012 Świetne mocne londyńskie Ale. Kolor ciemno bursztynowo czerwony, Mocna piana która się trzyma dłógo i pokaźnie się pręży. Zapach kwiatowo-dymny. W smaku dymiony, jakby wędzony posmak, chociaż nie jest to rauchbier. Wytrawny w końcówce, a smak pozostaje na dłógo po przełknieciu

Bottle- Dark amber/brown color; Medium slightly creamy body. 
Aroma of malt, caramel, & some hop. Flavor of slight roasted malt, hops, caramel, toffee, and light fruit; Finish is slightly bitter which I pretty enjoyed.

UPDATED: JUN 19, 2014 Pours reddish dark brown with a frothy head that leaves lots of lacing. Aroma is noticeable right after the beer is poured from the bottle. It is very malty - mostly sweetish bread and bisquit with caramel and dark fruits featuring as well. Taste is initially light sweet, later bitter; hops feature most in the delightfully balancing, dry finish. Malty, slightly toasty flavours dominate. The palate is medium bodied and the mouthfeel thick and a bit creamy. An excellent, well balanced classic. More than the sum of its parts.

Bottle from Waitrose. Pours crystal clear chestnut brown, with big off white foam head which holds. Nose is nutty, hazelnuts, chocolate malt, malt vinegar (not in a bad way, but like a fish n chips way), herbal. Taste is roasted malt, bitter spicy hops, herby, caramel, ale fruity. Not getting the fruit cake stuff, but this is a really good complex and well balanced English ale. Worthy of the hype.

Bottle from Venerables. Amber colour, creamy tan head. Nose is caramel, bready, soft fruity, some spices. Flavour is caramel malts, fruits, spices and some breadyness and toastiness. Creamy mouthfeeling. Soft,  roasty, slightly hoppy finish. Great stuff.
Bottle. Great deep amber appearance with thick creamy head. Looks appetizing. Taste and smells like fruit cake and bready with lots oof malt and flavor.Im usually not a fan of these but its Excellent

Bottle.  Pours a medium brown color with a one finger thick creamy head.  Rich aroma of cake, dried fruit, spices, cream, and caramel malt.  Love the taste, rich and smooth.  Its like liquid cake but without so much sweetness.  Slight bitterness helps to balance.  Creamy, fruity finish leaves a great flavor in the aftertaste.  I cant believe it took so long for me to try this.  Love it.

Close to an ESB, this beer still has a nice hop profile and remains drinkable at 6.3.  Bottled version is fantastic and shows how a more delicate beer can remain fresh and tight even in a bottle.  Fullers is to be respected.

Amber, white, creamy head. Nose is malty, dried fruit, coffee, toffee, citrus, hops. Taste is malt, caramel sweetness, citric notes, hops with a very nice balance. Some slight dryness, sweet malt, hops and licorice in the finish. Great brew.

500ml Bottle. Aroma is caramel chocolatey and roasted malt. Appearance is a dark reddish brown and the head is good and reasonably well lasting. Taste is malty and dried fruits with a bitter finish. Not brilliant but not bad either - at 6.3% its not a session beer.

Color old tea. Aroma hops, fruit. Taste hops, bitter. Palate bitter, lasting. Overall nice
Clear reddish brown colour, reddish foam, very fizzy. Sweet caramel, fruity smell. Soft on tongue, leaves bitterness. Sweet taste, caramel. Easy to drink, tasty sweet beer.
Gostei, bem forte, bela cor.
A rather good bottle conditioned ale. Quite strong aroma with hints of caramel, a bit woody. Amber - brown color, rather bitter in taste, medium bodied, with a bitter finish.

Dark amber color in the glass with small amount of head. Smells of caramel  malt and toffee and minimal hop aroma. Taste is of toffee/caramel with herbal hop flavor that is more prominent in the mouth than on the nose. Medium bodied with a surprising amount of carbonation. Very good beer.
Nice beer, strong tasting.  6.3% ABV.  So, the comment needs to be 85 characters, wtf. Im drinking beer not writing a freakin thesis.

Pours a very dark ruby brown with an aggressive tan head and glorious lacing. Malt and caramel fill the nose while roasted malts, caramel, coffee, and a hint of choclate greet the pallet. There is a note of malt sweetness but the sweetness is suppressed by the hops. NO MOLASSES TASTE. The mouthfeel is medium with just the right amount of carbination. A very rich and pleasing beer. Will buy and drink again. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Amber-red colour, with small beige head that sits down slowly. Intensive aroma of fruits, caramel, brown sugar, cookies, herbs. Nice bitter aroma, you can feel a bit higher grade of alcohol, but its not disturbing IMHO. Fantastic beer!
bottle . dark amber , big beige head . aroma is malty , dark fruit ,  well balanced taste of fruit cake , caramel , hop bitterness in the finish . full bodied , modest carbonation . excellent
(bottle 04/06-2012) medium beige head, clear dark amber color, soft co2, sweet caramel taste, light bitter, balanced light fruity taste. BB date 02 nov 2012.

500ml bottle. Aroma is strange but good, kind of a sweet, cedar, spicy thing with some English hops. Looks good, nice dark amber with lots of off white head. Taste is lots of fruitcake malt sweetness with big earthy hops, but it doesnt end up tasting like dirt. Finish was dry, body was full. Overall, big flavours, but well balanced.

Bottle from Bierzwerg: Deep amber and hazy colour with big white head. Aromas of biscuits, orange, citrus, dried fruits, caramel. Malty taste, with caramel, toffee and dried fruits. Medium body, average carbonation, bitter finish! Overall, one of the most balanced beers I had!

Bottle. Pours dark amber with a creamy off white head. Very malty aroma, thick biscuity caramel, toffee, some dried dark fruits, dates and prunes. Taste is quite malty, caramel, biscuit, little nuttiness with some raisins, also tiny bit of vegetal skunky hops that I dont much care for. Finish is unclean, long, sticky and bitter. Has some very nice elements to it and some parts to it Im not keen on
Fullers continues to dominate my top 10. I love the balance. I love the almost caramel flavor that exists in perfect harmony with the nutty bitterness.
0,5l bottle. Dark copper color.  Medium thick white head. Very faint watery aroma, doesnt say much. Bitter, caramel, hops in flavor.

500ml bottle. Aroma ismalty and sweet. Appearance is dark brown with a small white color. Taste is sweet and slightly sour. Palate is very fine. Strong malt flavour. Has a long and sweet finish. Light bitter. Very nice ale.

Bottle 0,5l at "La 100 de beri"
Appearance: Clear medium red amber color with a large, mostly lasting, good lacing, tan head. 
Aroma: malt, hopps, dried fruits, spices, caramel  
Taste:light sweet with a moderate to high bitter finish 
Palate:Body is medium, texture is watery, carbonation is average .
2012 - 04 -29 500ml bottle. dark-amber light-brown colour.medium off-white head. complex aroma, hints of fruit and coffee. medium sweet, light bitter taste.

50cl bottle. Pours deep amber with thin but lasting off-white head - medium to thick lacing. Aroma has plenty of dark fruits, raisins, bread, spices, deep caramel, slightly roasted malt, touch of floral hop

Brown 500ml bottle, best before 18th May 2011, drank 17th Jan 2010. Poured into a vase shaped pint glass.

Good thick tan/off white/cream coloured head, which produced some heavy lacing as the beer sank down the glass. The body was clear and a copper/brown colour, very beery looking!

Malts and molasses win the aroma battle, a sort of rich malt-loaf with butter lashed on smell.

The taste is also malt dominated, a little sweet at first mouthtouch, then it begin to dry out in the finish with a hop bitterness arriving in the aftertaste.

The alcohol is easy to find and sits well within the malty richness of the brew.

50cl bottle. Pours deep amber with thin but lasting off-white head - medium to thick lacing. Aroma has plenty of dark fruits, raisins, bread, spices, deep caramel, slightly roasted malt, touch of floral hop. Taste is incredibly full, with dark fruit playing a big part alongside thick bready and caramel malt, slight roasted woody notes, warming winter spices, floral and earthy hop flavours near the finish. Great balance - very smooth for such a complex ale, really enjoyed it.

50cl bottle. Dark brown with small, tanned head. Nose : small aromas overall : coffee, nuts, floral, dough, roasted bread. Sip : Oily with medium density and quite creamy. Sweet with coffee notes followed by floral and fruity hops finish. Aftertaste is mild and a bit like sweet coffee and cake aftertaste. Overall : enjoyable and interesting beer. For the moment one of my favorite english ales.

Deep amber. The nose is loaded with an array of spices and some dates and nuts. Medium bodied, this attacks the palate with a cascade of spices. Like Christmas cake, but with a savory flair. Balanced with an elegant display of hops.
Nice English strong ale. The flavour is a bit caramelly, but feels a bit pale ale-influented, with a nice bitterness. It has an ABV of 6,3%, wich works great.

(500mL from LCBO) Poured cool, a dark amber-red with a fluffy tan head that left lots of lacing. Aroma of toasted caramel malts, sweet and a little fruity with light hops.  Flavour toffee, caramel, toast, some dark fruit, spicy hops, earthiness and a little yeasty funk. Alcohol a little noticeable on the dry finish. Mouthfeel fairly full creamy with a little booze.  Very tasty English Strong.
Pours dark amber with a medium white head. A nice beer I prefer the porter but this is worth a try

Very nice example.
This could well be an old style bre, it takes me back in time with arome and palate.
Pous a beautiful golden rather thick with a nice dense head.
Alot of everything going on.
Give it time and explore how the taste and palate change with temperature .. not bad at all.

0,5l bottle from British Store, Budapest. Clear, reddish amber color, with short-life, off-white head. Malty and caramel odor. Sweet, fruity, honey, caramel malty aroma with alcohol and some light spicy hops, which makes it balanced. Medium bitter-sweet taste. Light to medium body with creamy texture and average carbonation. Malty and hoppy finish with spices, fruits and maybe some resin. Its a very good, mature beer (thanks for the 100 days of maturing), theres a perfect harmony between the hops and the malt. Also a good choise for every-day drinking, like ESB. If ESB is a light IPA, 1845 is a light, fruity barley wine...
Clear deep red body, creamy off white head. Malty aroma with caramel and bread. Very nice spicy flavour with bread, caramel, butter, orange and a hoppy finish. Very nice.

I really liked this beer.  A nice dark brown color and rich creamy head clung to the glass long after the beer was finished.  I found the beer to be overly bitter (which I like).  I recommend this to anybody that likes full flavored English beers.

UPDATED: JUN 6, 2012 Pours golden, clear. Initial aroma is malty, with subtle complexities of toasted malt, nuts, bread, maybe a little dried fruit, but its not at all sweet. The hop presence is very evident but it mostly balances out the malt, even though it lingers slightly at the finish. Overall, I find this to be one the best English strong ale Ive had. I dont think it stacks up better than many of the micro-brewed American strong ales, but it certainly has it place in the mix. Its worth trying now and then.

Update: June 2012, cellared bottle, 15 months old. Still essentially the same beer. Perhaps more roasted notes coming through at the expense of other malt flavors. Hops still very balancing and evident, and there is a mild lingering hop bitterness at the finish. Not sure if this will improve or not. So far cellaring is not making a big difference.
Britain in a bottle. Earthy hops, perfumy, jam, marmalade, nutty, deep Amber/ruby colour, medium head. Flavour is the same as the nose.
A bottle at Bishop Arms, Skövde. Bark amber beer with a big lacy offwhite head. Hoppy and malty aroma and flavour.Nice beer :-)

Burnished copper with a thin off, white head.  Nose of toasted malt, pine and burnt sugar.  Strong malt body, hint of alcohol, noticeable hop bitterness.  There is considerable finesse for a beer of this strength here.   An excellent English ale.

16.03.2012. 0,5l Bottle. Circa, Tromsø. Dark brown colour woth white head. Aroma of dark malts. Flsvours of dark malts and bitterness with coffee notes. Dry bitter finish. nice smooth beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Totally forgot this brew in my cellar and realized I had never rated it. Passed its best before date, but still looks and smells great. Lets try it !! Pours a darker amber colour with a mahogany hue. Great off-white frothy head with very good retention and foamy lacing. Aromas of raisins with caramel malts and nuts. Wet mouthfeel and medium-bodied. Flavours of roasted malts, dates, other dark fruits and sweet malts. The raisins smell and taste become more dominant. I guess, this is where it is outdated, but nonetheless, it still is good to drink and interesting.

Bottle. Poured a clear dark amber color. The head was three fingers high and light tan with good retention. Malty toffee and brown sugar in the nose with whiffs of spiced orange, raisin and date. Medium bodied with low to moderate carbonation. Slightly sweet up front with the sugars lingering into the middle. Dryer and delicately bitter at the end.

Dark to nid brown beer with a thickish beige coloured head. Fruity sweet nose of dried fruits and candied peel with a distinctly liquorice aroma and a slightly burnt malt smell. Dry mouthfeel. Bittersweet taste. The burnt malty flavour and a hint of hop is balanced with the sweetness coming through of the fruity elements from the aroma. Bittersweet in the finish.

0,5l bottle. Dark amber hazy brown reddish with beige rocky lacing head. Aromas are caramel, roasted malts, plums. Palate is medium full bodied, texture slick medium oily, carbonation soft and smooth. Taste some chocolate, wrapped in a nice roasted malty medium sweetness and good dry flavour. Finish dry with some hops and distinct sweetish malty vibe with decent dry bitter hints. Very tasty, although little on the sweet side. Good ale.

Bottle--looks just like a classic British ale should look like.  Nice deep color with a small/medium, light beige head.  Malty aroma mixed with fruit such as raisins.  Nice toffee and caramel flavor with a slight fruit bite.   Warm biscuit finish.  Takes me back to many a pleasant night spent in a good British pub.   
Produce place.

50cl Bottle from De Bierkoning. Clear ruby amber colour, dense off white head, looks stunning. Aroma of toasted malts, caramel, coffee, hint of cabbage but not in a bad way, nutmeg. Flavour is light sweet, malty, some coffee/moccha, bitter roast, amber malts, bit of caramel, firm hoppy light fruity bitter finish. Medium bodied, slick. Really nice beer imo.
This copper coloured ale has red fruit, currants and burnt toffee flavours with hints of chocolate and a sweet caramel finish. Bottle Conditioned.

Clear deep copper, nice foamy off white head, which leaves a very definitive stepped lacing. Aroma of dark fruit and sweet malt. Strong roasted malt taste, dried fruits, some caramel and spice. Well hopped, with some alcohol. Long dry bitter finish. LBW (Lagerboys Be Wary)

500ml bottle. Pours a hazy ruby-amber, with a fairly large off-white head, which dissipates fairly quickly, without leaving a huge amount of lacing. Plum and prune notes mix well with some fruitcake and cinnamon on the nose. Very mild, fruity hops lead into a slightly boozy fruitcake flavour up front. It gives way to smooth toffee in the body. Sweet plum and candied fruits signal a lasting, fruity finish. Another classy beer from Fullers, this is a classic sweeter English strong ale, full of luscious fruit flavours.

500ml bottle. Dark amber with small off-white head. Complex aroma & taste: Caramel, toffee, dark fruit, some alcohol . If you take the taste for an overall impression and not in an analytic mode theres a strange, unbalanced and somewhat displeasing note I cannot describe other than "purulence". What a bummer! Sets it back a better score.

fles 50cl
Kleur: robijnrood met een kleine cremeschuimkraag
Geur: gebrand mout.
Smaak: Licht bitter en gebrand mout, wat je voornamelijk in de nasmaak proeft. Medium koolzuur.
Dark brown. Aromas of malt and caramel. Flavour malt, caramel, toffee and slight hint of coffee
Bottle. Brown red with a thin head. Strong aroma of caramel and cyrup. Flavour is coffee and roasted malt. Silky texture. Medium to full body.

Ruby/amber with a small white head. Aroma is mostly malty with some spice and caramel. Medium body. Tingles the tongue. Mostly malty flavor with hop bitterness, spice, fruit and a hint of roast. A nice bitter finsih. An excellent beer.
UPDATED: FEB 29, 2012 Bottle. Amber colour with a light beige head. Moderate fruity nose with some sweet caramel. Solid malt backgroud in the flavour with lots og fruitiness, also some alcohol.
Bottle. Pours dark copper with a nice head. Aroma caramel, some grass. Slightly burnt malts in the taste. Medium palate. Good traditional Fullers product. Not Bad.

A dark amber coloured beer with a small beige head. The aroma is malty with notes of dried fruits, raisin and chocolate. The taste is bittersweet with malt characters like dried fruits, chocolate and toffee. But its also spicy and peppery. The aftertaste is spicy and bitter. Its a fantastic beer!

Complex dark fruit dominates the aroma.  The flavor is strongly malty and fruity, like an ESB on steroids plus some.  A very lingering finish to this, an incredibly great ale, not one of this brewerys ales is anything other than awesome and this ale more than helps to prove that.
Aroma of burnt toffee, red fruit and nutty maltiness. Taste is caramel, treacle and prunes followed by hop bitterness. Woody. Some warming alcohol too. Complex, wonderful beer.

Bottle 6.3% poured a ruby brown with off white head smells of toffee and caramel to taste burnt toffee spices with depths of flavour and a lovley warmth on the aftertaste and long lived flavour excellent ale

A dark but clear brown with a tan one finger head with medium size bubbles.Mild caramel and nutmeg aroma. Medium bitterness with a dark fruit taste.Has a touch of sourness but has clean finish. Can some warmth going down. Nice brew on a cool evening.

Pours a deep hazy red with a big white head and good lace. 

The aroma is toasty malt, some red apple, some sweet toffee, a little bit of lavender & light chocolate.

The flavor is nicely earthy and surprisingly bitter with a good leafy hop expression, plenty of toasty malt, and some light caramel. The beer is lightly spicy and in no way is it overly sweet. 

A nice beer, certainly different from what I was expecting.

UPDATED: JUN 17, 2012 Bottle. Pours an auburn mahogany with a small, large-bubbled, yellowish-brown head. Aroma is caramel, marmelade, candied/dried fruit, candied orange zest, resin. Taste is resinous, some pine, caramel, tones of nuttiness. Aftertaste is wood, some resin and pine. Palate is nice and medium. Not as good as I expected. English strong ale probably isnt my style, it seems.

Hát többet vártam ám tőle.
Száraz. Amúgy meg: bread, floral, dough, earthy, amber, frothy, medium bitterness, maybe umami, medium body,

1845 is a dark mahogany amber with a yellowish beige head atop. Thick bands of sticky lacing are left on the glass. The nose is well malted with noticable biscuity Crystal and Maris Otter malts. Notes of toffee, bread, fruitcake and a rich biscuit. A hint of hop on the nose is quite subtle. My first taste was rich and complex with a nice toasty middle. A lingering aftertaste of light hops, nutmeg and allspice and a nice alcohol. Notes of candied fruits and raisins with a light brown sugary sweetness are overcome by the dry, hopped up spice finish. 1845 is medium to full bodied with a slightly sticky mouthfeel. A good amount of fizzy carbonation on the tongue. Overall, this is a fantastic brew with very atypical flavors.

Bottle conditioned: Nice initial aroma of candied fruit. Excellent mouth feel, soft and warming. Nice malty body with red fruit and candied fruit jostling away. Terrible finish though. ...like liquefied horse chestnut. Hides the alcohol well though.

Bottle from Waitrose for the UK Mass Tasting. Pours a beautiful ruby colour with a thick, light tan head. Aroma of apple seed, yeast, alcohol and dried fruits. Flavours of prunes, treacle and barley with a dry apple seed linger. Quite bitter with a nice warming alcohol hum. Moderate carbonation and a little CO2 prickle. OK.

50 cl bottle @ home, BBE 02.11.2012
A bit thin aroma with toffee, grainy malt and some metal. Flavour is sweetish and rather malty with toffee, some metal and grain. Hops feel a bit harsh here. Smooth palate.

Excellent beer. Nice dark amber with a really nice head. Aroma of pale and caramel malts, fruitiness, and mild hops. Well balanced flavor between the malt and hops. Medium-full bodied with just the right carbonation. Again, very nicely balanced.

UPDATED: APR 27, 2012 (Bottle, 0.5 l - BBE 02 NOV 12, 20111208) The beer poured mahogany coloured and clear. Its head was medium sized and white. Aroma had malts, dark fruits, dried plum and raisins. Palate was full bodied and quite dry with medium carbonation. Flavours were malts, dark fruits, caramell, herbalness and bitterness. Afertaste was malty, raisiny and bitter. A good tasting English Strong Ale. I wish I could have tasted the real ale version when it was available in Helsinki.

Edit: 20120427, The real ale version at Kittys was good but it was not so different from the bottled one that I would have needed to adjust my ratings.

Malty smell with hints figs.  Cloudy copper with a creamy thick tan head.  Smooth mouthfeel, moderate carbonation.  Taste is good, but I was expecting much more after the wonderful nose of this beer.  Good malt backbone with a slight fruity yeasty note, and a hint of caramel.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Ruddy red-brown, off-white head. A nice malty aroma, caramel sweetness, a slight hint of candied chestnuts and dark fruits. Oak. The taste is a bit bitter and pepper. Wonderfully rounded, mature mouthfeel. This is beautifully conditioned. Nice carbonation. This is one of my favorite Fullers beers. Dependable and satisfying.

A deep, dark coppery brown colored pour. Huge muslin colored head that slowly falls and leaves big lacing behind. Rich malty aroma with notes of bread, nuts, and slight hops. Taste is similar with an added extra nuttiness and hop flavor. A dry yeast flavor as well. Dry mouthfeel. Bitter aftertaste. Decent ale.
Aroma of dried fruits. Sweetness, with Christmas cake in the mix. The finish is drier with some hops.  Nice dark colour  with a good white head.

Bottle @ Henrik, Bergen. Pours a deep coppery red body with a medium, long-lived creamy off-white head. Light caramel and toffee tones dominate the aroma, with hints of nuts and grains. Taste is deep roasty grainy caramel tones with some nuts and layers of sweet malts - all exquisitely blended. Another British-style classic ale from Fullers, who rarely disappoints. Solid stuff.

0.5l bottle @ Henrik, Bergen. A deep copper near-clear beer with a heavy lacing creamy off-white head. Caramel aroma but also quite malty. Nice without being to much. It has a average carbonation level and a mild oily really smooth mouthfeel. Both dried fruits, plums and nuts in the somewhat malty and sweet flavor. Really balanced and quite smooth stuff this. Quite enjoyed this one. Have to try again!
Nice foam, looks beautiful in a pint glass. Not much aroma though and not the strong taste youd expect. A nice winter warmer but nothing amazing.

50cl bottle. Pours a copper color with an off-white head. Nose is sweet and fruity with a little bit of hops and herbs in the background. Flavor is quite well-balanced with a heavy, apple-and-cherry fruit-like malt contrasted against moderate bitter hops. Very sticky and rich. Alcohol is quite present considering its only 6% ABV. Overall, nice but certainly not mindblowing.

Bottle, tfs rick. Aroma is nutty, roast, some malty caramel..
Flavour is roasted malt, coffee, some nutty notes, long lingering hops and roast and keeps developing. Great stuff.

50cl bottle from ABCbeers.
 Thin white head.  Nice clear amber pour.  Very smooth

500 ml bottle, can smell the fruit and alcohol. Pours dark golden with tan head which remains low, nice lacing. Flavours long lasting and complex. Initial fruity, nutty and alcohol well balanced and slightly bitter and quite sweet with hints of caramel. Nutty aftertaste smooth with lots of body and warming spices. Later on, hoppy bitterness and floral aroma and taste comes through.
Bottled. Nice hazy brown coloured, smells sweet, with caramel taste.However a dry finish. Very good.

Fullers 1845

Strong Ale

Full body ale with a nice golden brown robe. Bitter with a long bitter and hoppy finale leaving in your mouth a lightly bitter taste (no pun intended). Has a nice floral aroma with notes of berried beneath the bitter alcoolic blancket you would expect in a more potent ale like this one. The 1845 reminds me of the ESB with more body. Clearly they deserve their award for this strong ale.

Bottle. Dark tan with some suspended yeast. Medium head. Medium carbonation. Malty aroma with grassy hops and alcohol. Taste is complex, featuring toasty malt, dry alcohol, honey sweetness and a little bitterness. Very balanced ale. Gets better as it warms up.

Bottled, 0.5l. Clear dark bronze colour with large frothy head and average carbonation. Strong aroma of caramel and tea. Sweet malty taste, strong honey notes, but quite dry finish and mild hoppy aftertaste. Full bodied, oily texture and flat carbonation in palate. A bit strange taste, howevery very drinkable...

At a tasting, thanks mom and dad, small stable head, a touch hazy deep red colour, aroma of toffee, dried fruits and caramel,  flavour of hay, tobbaco and burned sugar. Bitter and a bit unpleasant aftertase. Dissapointing.

Dark red-brown in colour with a thin but dense head when poured from the bottle. Powerful alcohol aroma, malt and charred wood. Flavours fruitcake - like and malty - christmas pudding and brandy butter. Sweetness and bitterness both come through on the aftertaste. Heavy texture, very warming. Good winter beer.

Pours a dark ruby garnet with a big frothy white head.  Aroma is intense malts.  Dark and earthy with some fig and a little smokey.  Taste again is a ton of malt flavours.  Earthy, roasted, fig, with a weird minty or medicinal aftertaste.  Still awesome,  Fullers does it again.

Serving: 500 ml. bottle from Wegmans Leesburg.  It pours a beautiful clear amber color with a large head of light tan foam.  The nose leans towards the lighter side with some caramel, slight grain, and bread notes.  The flavor has a slight metallic twinge.  Lots of malt there.  Very bready with some caramel and dried fruit.  A little bit of dried, leafy hops and a lingering bitterness on the back end.  Some tea perhaps.  The alcohol has a drying effect which is nice.  Medium to full body with slightly lower than average carbonation.  Nice.
Not too carbonated.  Raisins, cinnamon, caramel shifting to herbaceous hoppy bitterness.  A touch of lingering heat and pepper from the alcohol, but otherwise very well balanced.  Delicious.

Bottle @ Cafe Buitenlust, Oirschot. Shared with Dutchdrebus. Nice dark red color, average sized off-white head. Smell lightly sweet and malts. Taste bitter, malts, some sweetness. Decent carbo, medium body.

As soon as I open the bottle I get whiffs of toffee and even chocolate.  Pours a clear deep red with thick off-white foamy head.  Upfront aromas are about the malts, with a lovely mix of toffee, grains, chicory, dark fruits.  Taste: theres a ton going on in here.  Wildly complex malts as the aroma suggests.  There are a lot of warm spices in here too - cinnamon, nutmeg.  Gentle lift of warming alcohol.  All of this without getting at all syrupy.  Bittering hops to balance.  Nice

Sweet aroma with dried fruits. Raisins, caramel and a little bit of spice come through on the palate with a very mild hop flavour. The alcohol is noticeable, but not overwhelming. Finish is kind of weak.
Just isint for me taste isint to my likeing giveing to me buy a friend whos an ale drinker and he loves it
Molto torrefatta, che altro potrei dire? Luppoli in secondo, terzo, quarto piano

This is by far the best Fullers Ive ever had. (Fullers night)

Mahogany  pour wuth an aroma  of bread and caramel malts,

Flvors of hop, spice, earth, and fruit. A mild wood finish. I liked it.
Ruby red colour with a decent off-white head. Smells very sweet, malts. Tastes very sweet, like bock. Okay but not great. Good carbo, medium body.
dark fruit and caramel in the aroma.  Lots of flavor, with brown bread, caramel, nut, and orange.  Dry finish.  Really nice beer, but definitely a sipper.

500ml bottle aged a couple of years, pours a deep red-brown with a fizzy off-cream head, citrus hops and a chunk of demerara sugar and burnt caramel on the nose. Crisp on the tongue, then turning juicy and chewy, with a good alcohol bite, lots of dried dark fruit and nut character, and a touch - inevitably - of the typical Fullers dark marmalade. Roasted bitter orange and caramel decorate a finish that is surprisingly dry-bitter for such a full body.

500mL bottle.  Pours a brownish-ruby with off-white foamy head.  Aroma is cranberry and other dark fruits, some booze, vanilla.  Sweet flavor: caramel, dark fruit, some hop presence, alcohol.  Noticeable carbonation; dry finish with a lingering taste of apple.

Bottle. Deep ruby colour with slightly tan head. Aroma I found a little thin, but the taste more than made up for it. Malty, with great hop balance, some fruitiness and woodiness. The long bitter finish is great. Very nice.
Bottle, pours a nice amber, taste is very english and smells so as well. it is a really solid brew, I like this one a lot. definitely a good. Really well balanced and it is quite strong.

Poured out of a 500ml bottle into an english pint.

Pours a dark copper/ruby with a 2 finger off-white head. Excellent head retention and lacing.

Smells of caramel and dried fruit, possibly some wood.

Taste is much like the smell. Slightly stronger woodsy notes with a caramel and toffee. A slightly drying finish along with a soft bitterness.

Mouthfeel is medium to full but does not impede drinkability

Overall a wonderful beer and an excellent example of the style. The perfect choice for a cool fall evening.
UPDATED: SEP 2, 2012 Sweet perfection!  dark amber body and frothy beige head, very bubbly with considerable lacing.  Bouquet of yeasty caramelized malts.

500 ml bottle from LCBO.  Pours deep copper in colour, with big caramel coloured head, tonnes of lacing.  Aroma is Marris Otter malt, same flavour.  Hints of nutmeg and Christmas spices.  Really good!

UPDATED: JAN 3, 2012 Tasted from bottle into tulip glass. Poured a deep reddish-brown color with full off-white foam, some retention, excellent lace. Aromas of mild English hops, fresh baked bread, caramelized brown sugar, boiled fruit preserves. Rich sweetness of a complex grainbill (toasty, biscuity, caramelly, roasty) stands up to a pronounced hops bitterness, tastes of roasted nuts, raisins, apricot, plum, black currants, cranberries, black licorice. Medium body and almost "chewy" mouthfeel. Superb bottle conditioning carbonation. Significant alcohol by volume, which is pleasantly warming but in no way harsh. As far as Im concerned, this is one of the worlds greatest beers, and the very model for a big brown ale.
50 cl bottle, Sheffield, UK via Tesco. Sweet raisin aroma, some cinnamon and almost burnt malts. Sweet initially, then a long building dry hop flavour, resin and an earthy herbalness to the finish.
500ml bottle cellar cool. Lovely spicy orangey aroma. Pours dark amber with a white head. Fruity marmalade and dundee cake flavour with warming alcohol. Delicious.

Aroma: Caramel, malt, toffee, butterscotch. Thats a nice aroma. Appearance: Opaque brown, some carbonation, thin frothy beige head. Palate: Quite thick, quite a bite at the end. Taste: dmugawugamuwaapfdsiujhgdjp. Very sweet, very rich, bit also quite a bitter finish. I like it!

500 ml bottle from LCBO.  Pours a hazy copper/amber with moderate-sized off-white head.  Aroma is toasty toffee, dark fruit, light spice and mild chocolate.  Flavour is roasted caramel malt, dried fruit, molasses and spice.  Moderate bitterness in finish.  Nice medium-full body.  Very good.

Much better than their ESB, this 1845 is absolutely amazing! One of the most flavorful strong ales that I have had in quite a long time! It has a nice warming effect from the alcohol as you savor this brew. Call me strange but this would be perfect (for me at least) paired up with some rum cake or a delicious fruit cake!

Fullers 
1845
Pours dark coppery brown with a thick white head. Good retention. Great looking beer. Aroma of malt and metal with a little fuggle spice hop note. Flavor is English malty with a mild spice bitterness and some caramel. Pretty good

500 mL bottle from the LCBO, served in a snifter. Pours clear ruby with a large, frothy tan head. The head mostly remains and leaves a moderate amount of fine lace. On the nose, there are notes of toasted malts, biscuit, pale malts and Goldings, along with a delicate Christmas spice, candied fruit and a touch of dough. The flavour is slightly dry up front and becomes more so towards the end. Throughout, there are notes of candied fruit, nutmeg and molasses. Hops become more prominent towards the finish, which is long and dry, with hops, nutmeg and spice. On the palate, it is full in body with a smooth, creamy texture and soft carbonation. Overall, this is a very nice English strong ale. It is drier than I expected, but is still appropriately malt-forward. It is surprisingly complex and I suspect it would hold up well to aging. 2011-10-03

This is a tremendous beer from a legitimately great big brewer. Big malt all the way through. Dark fruit, figs, caramel and maybe even a touch of chocolate come through. very complex. Pours medium dark with medium carbonation and a bit creamy in the mouth.

Nice looking deep brown pour with decent foamy tan head. Caramel, oak, brown sugar, earthy, and mildly boozy aroma. That just smells damn interesting. Somewhat sweet, malty taste, the extra alcohol adds a pleasant kick to the finish. This is just damn good.
UPDATED: OCT 14, 2011 Really delicious aroma, and appearance. nice head, strong, smooth complex taste. however, personally, it does leaves quite a bitter after taste, so ive marked down for this.
Bottle.  Pours amber with a half inch head.  Aroma of dried fruits.  Flavor is very malty and a little sweet.  Medium palate.  Enjoyable beer.

50cl bottle. Mahogany, beige head.
Dark fruit aroma.
Fruity bitterness balanced with a slight sweetness, peppery finish.
Superb.
Strong malty backbone with fruits, caramel and a bit of hops. Very complex and satisfying.

500ml bottle.  Pours a dark reddish brown with a frothy off-white head.  Aroma is on the lighter side but with noticable biscuity dark malt notes, cocoa, alcohol, and faint dried fruits.  VERY flavourful.  Dried fruits to start, followed by earthy molasses, cocoa, coffee, with some dough, and black licorice in a British styled hop finish.  An excellent beer.

faint caramel aroma. dark red/brown pour. roasty nut malt flavour with a fruity hop flavour in the finish, light bitterness. this one was surprisingly good. my only  complaint was the bits of crap floating around in it.

UPDATED: JUN 22, 2012 Beautiful clear ruby-brown.  Aroma is delicious caramelly, with cherries and raisin.  Malty caramel taste, with roasted malt, burnt sugar, some cherries and raisins, and a bitter dark chocolate finish. You can really taste the roasted malt in the aftertaste.   A super solid English ale - the best Ive had.

Sweet candy aroma, with a bit of grass, very British ale. nice head, but low retention.  Gorgeous red-brown and perfecty clear. Brown flavor, if that makes sense; a bit roasty and delicious. Hints of caramel. Mmm. An excellent English ale. I have no complaints at all. The aftertaste is all roasted barley and tasty as they come. Wonderful stuff.
roasty, earthy, red, clear, minimal head, light sweetness, medium bitterness, lightly sour, medium body, oily feel, creamy, average carbonation,

back in uk, beer for good jurney :), absolutelly fantastic aroma, strong hoppy, whiskey brown colour, white to light brown foammedium sweetness, medium bitterness, awesome full taste, nice ballancedfull body, slick feel, soft carbonation, long finish, bitter, fantastic beer
user_location: Cambridge and Kladno(Czech Rep.), Cambridgeshire, ENGLAND

text: Fullers är verkligen ett stabilt bryggeri. 1845 är en välhumlad - för att var engelsk - strong ale. Det är goldingshumlen som ger både rejäl beska och den där blommiga men också lätt unkna, som en sommarbukett på nära håll, doften och smaken som man antingen älskar eller hatar. Jag tycker allt mer om den. Den matchas av sötma från kristallmalten och stadiga 6,3%. Lätt metallisk eftersmak men ändå ett fint öl.

Közepesen sötét, vörösesbarna színe van, a rajta keletkező hab termetes, nagy buborékokkal teli, bézs színű és igen kitartó. Illata enyhén nedves kávézaccos, karamellás, kissé dohos és virágos. Melaszos, pörkölt magvas, mogyorós,  kormos és kissé aszalt gyümölcsös, enyhén csípős íze van, amibe keveredik egy kis zöld gyógyfű és maláta. Közepes teste van, a magasabb alkohol tartalom jól rejtett és elég buborékos. Utóíze keserédes,kissé gyümölcsös és poros, igen hosszan tart. Finom erős ale, ami szépen kiegyensúlyozott és igen egyedi.

Bottle from Csak a jó sör. Poured clear, with a deep ruby color and a tan, pillowy foam. Aroma not too complex; caramel, candy sugar, plum, raisins, hints of ash, woodcask, and plenty of hops. Medium bodied with high carbonation. Sweet, dark fruity taste that is harshly interrupted by a self-confident bitterness, which dominates the aftertaste. Well balanced overall, well done.
Another great example of a strong session beer. This ismthe beer for those people that feel they have graduated from the 3.5abv session beers to the over 6 club. Easy to drink.

Clear chestnut pour thin off white head ..... aroma of caramel, toffee, little fruity and nutty ..... taste is very smooth with a caramel, toffee and spicy taste up front with a nutty, roasted and fruity feel .... the finish has a nice spicy bitter hop and the abv is hidden .... loved it lots of fresh and tasty flavors

500 mL bottle at home into a pint glass.  Brown dark amber beer with a well formed head.  Lovely aroma, chocolatey and sweet with fruit.  Tastes of caramelised sugars, oak and caramel.  Unusually well rounded for English beer, and very tasty.  Leaves a bit of a dry aftertaste.  One of Englands finest.

Szép küllemű, tükrösen gesztenyebarna ale, ujjnyi vastagságú, piszkosfehér színű (a pohár szélét is kicsipkéző) habtakaróval a tetején, amely szinte az utolsó kortyig kitart.
Az élénken pezsgő italból aszalt gyümölcsös illatok áramlanak az orrba.
Csípősen indul a kóstolása, melyet aztán az előbbi aszalt gyümölcsös, majd.karamellás, édes-fanyar (némi fűszeres komlóval aláfestett) zamatok követnek. Testessége szirupos és elfogyasztása kissé nehézkes, de ettől függetlenül a viszonylag magasabb alkoholtartalom remekül el van rejtve.
Befejezése hosszan tartó és száraz, melyet citrusok és pörkölt mogyoróra emlékeztető (utó)ízek kísérnek.
Biz élvezetes és jól kiegyensúlyozott...

UPDATED: OCT 25, 2011 This is a delicious, sweet, malty treat. The aroma is too sweet, alcoholic, and even ripe at first, making for a rather mixed first impression, but as it mellows out with temperature, it gets sweeter in a much more elegant and complex kind of way, with dried fruits, nuts and loads of caramel coming out, and the malt backbone taking more of a supporting role. The beer pours a beautiful brown and develops a medium head, but it doesnt keep it for too long. The taste is wonderful, with the bread character of the malts really coming through.
